view1: The old grandmother Sofia arrives in town to attend the graduation ceremony of her nephew Leo with his girlfriend Sophia. Upon arrival she discovers that she has been stolen of a family heirloom that her late mother had given her. She goes to the university's lost and found to file a complaint and get the dear object back, but given the length of the investigation, she decides to carry out the search for the thief herself, combining a great deal of research. Eventually, by chance, she finds the thief, who lives in the same dormitory, also managing to have an entire group of students arrested. The nephew Leo can graduate and the grandmother Sofia will be appointed, by merit, an honorary professor of the university.
view2: The old grandmother Sofia arrives in town to attend her niece's wedding, but upon arrival she discovers that her prized possession, a family heirloom locket, has been stolen from her purse. She goes to the local security office to report the theft and is initially met with skepticism, but eventually convinces them to take action. With the help of a young intern named Leo, Sofia takes matters into her own hands and tracks down the thief, who turns out to be a former employee of the hotel where she's staying. In a thrilling confrontation, Sofia manages to recover the locket and expose the thief's accomplices, earning herself a hero's welcome at the wedding ceremony.

view1: The last remnants of humanity's hope, the Aurora ship, had been sent to Mars to escape the Unlight invasion that ravaged Earth. But as they descended onto the barren surface, they realized their oxygen supply was malfunctioning. With only 48 hours left before they succumbed to suffocation, a team of five engineers embarked on a perilous journey across the treacherous terrain to find a hidden underground cache of spare parts. As they navigated through toxic dust storms and Unlight patrols, they stumbled upon an ancient Martian temple that held the secrets of their ancestors. The engineers made a groundbreaking discovery about Mars' unique properties that could save their lives, but at a steep price: they had to stay on the red planet forever.
view2: The last remnants of humanity had fled to Mars after the Earth's oceans turned toxic, but the Unseen threat remained, hiding in the vast dunes of crimson sand. A lone squad of soldiers was sent on a mission to uncover their enemy's secret underground base, but they were ambushed and left for dead. With only 48 hours of air left, the four survivors must navigate treacherous sandstorms, avoid deadly traps, and fight off the Unseen's relentless pursuit to reach the extraction point before it's too late.

view1: The year is 2050, and the world is on the brink of collapse due to climate change. The United Nations establishes the 'Earth Renewal Initiative', a global organization tasked with finding solutions to reverse the damage. Led by the charismatic and determined Director, Sofia Patel, a former Indian diplomat, they embark on a mission to convince governments and corporations to adopt sustainable practices. A new form of currency, called the Eco-Note, is introduced, which incentivizes people to invest in renewable energy and eco-friendly technologies. In parallel, a team of scientists in Australia develop a revolutionary technology that can convert CO2 into oxygen at an unprecedented rate. The initiative's success relies on the cooperation between nations, as they work together to implement large-scale geoengineering projects, including massive seawall construction and reforestation efforts. As the years pass, the Earth begins to heal, and the effects of climate change slowly reverse. The story concludes with a new era of peace and prosperity, where humanity has learned to live in harmony with nature.
view2:
{
  "": "The year is 2050, and the world is facing an unprecedented crisis: the effects of climate change are ravaging the planet, causing widespread droughts, famines, and natural disasters. In response, a new international organization, the Terra Verde Initiative, is formed to coordinate global efforts to mitigate the damage. Led by Maria Rodriguez, a former UN Secretary-General, the initiative sets out to develop a comprehensive plan to restore the planet's ecosystems and ensure a sustainable future for all.

The Terra Verde Initiative proposes a radical solution: a global carbon dividend program, where every citizen receives an annual stipend based on their country's carbon emissions. The idea is simple: by giving people a financial incentive to reduce their carbon footprint, we can create a mass movement towards sustainability.

In the Arctic Circle, a team of scientists and engineers embark on a daring project to harness the power of geothermal energy. By drilling into the Earth's crust and tapping into the planet's internal heat, they aim to generate clean electricity for entire cities.

Meanwhile, in the Amazon rainforest, indigenous communities are working with international researchers to develop new sustainable agriculture practices that minimize deforestation and promote biodiversity. The goal is to create a model for regenerative farming that can be replicated across the globe.

As the Terra Verde Initiative gains momentum, world leaders begin to take notice. Governments start to implement policies that support the program, and citizens around the world begin to make changes in their daily lives. The carbon dividend program becomes a catalyst for a global shift towards sustainability, and the planet starts to heal.

Years go by, and the effects of the Terra Verde Initiative are nothing short of miraculous. CO2 levels drop, forests regrow, and wildlife populations rebound. The world is on the path to becoming carbon neutral, and humanity h

view1: Emily Evans' brother, Jack, was once a brilliant and ambitious young man. However, after a near-fatal accident on his first day of college, he began to experience strange and terrifying episodes. As the years went by, Emily's family struggled to cope with Jack's increasingly erratic behavior, culminating in a violent outburst that left their mother hospitalized. When the police showed up at their doorstep, Emily was faced with an impossible choice: protect her brother or turn him in for his crimes.
view2: After years of estrangement, Rachel reunites with her sister Emma, who's struggling to cope with the loss of her husband in a tragic accident. As Rachel tries to reconnect with Emma and their niece, she discovers that Emma is hiding a dark secret: she's been embezzling funds from her late husband's company to pay for his medical treatments. Torn between loyalty to her sister and a sense of justice, Rachel must choose between covering up the truth or exposing Emma's deceit, threatening to destroy their fragile relationship and their family's future.

view1: A struggling artist, Alex (John Krasinski), is surprised by his eccentric aunt, Luna (Tilda Swinton), who shows up at his studio with a suitcase full of her belongings and convinces him to join her on a weekend-long spiritual retreat called 'Elysium'. As they descend into the depths of the retreat's bizarre rituals and seductive games, Alex's life begins to unravel in unexpected ways.
view2: A struggling artist, Alex (Jesse Eisenberg), is surprised at his studio by his eccentric and free-spirited cousin, Jamie (Jason Schwartzman). Jamie has just returned from a week-long 'Creative Awakening' retreat in Bali and is bursting with enthusiasm about the life-changing experiences he had there. He convinces Alex to join him on another weekend-long retreat called 'Flow', promising it will unlock his full artistic potential. As they embark on this journey, Alex finds himself drawn into a world of avant-garde performances, experimental art, and unconventional relationships that threaten to upend his entire life.

view1: Ava Morales, a rebellious 22-year-old, gets into a fight with her abusive mother and is released on probation to live with her estranged grandmother in a small coastal town. Assigned to work with a strict social worker, Rachel Patel, Ava is falsely accused of vandalizing public property and begins an affair with Rachel's sister-in-law, causing tension between Ava and the social worker.
view2: After a reckless joyride, reckless 22-year-old Jake Harris is sentenced to community service under the supervision of strict social worker Emily Patel in a small town. As he struggles with his newfound responsibilities, rumors spread about an illicit relationship between him and Emily, forcing Jake to clear his name before he can pursue his dream of becoming a journalist.

view1: Four struggling artists, Alex, Mia, Leo and Emma, are desperate to make it big in the city's competitive art scene. Despite their initial failure at a local gallery showing that exposes their lack of talent, they become convinced they can pull off an elaborate forgery scheme. Meanwhile, their eccentric families' antics spiral out of control as they try to navigate the cutthroat world of art and deception.
view2: Four struggling artists, Alex, Maya, Jake and Emily, are desperate to make it big in the city's competitive art scene. Despite their lack of talent, they convince themselves they can pull off a high-stakes forgery scheme. Meanwhile, their eccentric families wreak havoc on their lives as they try to navigate the cutthroat world of art galleries and collectors.

view1: Alexander Adams IV is a wealthy socialite who fakes his own death to join the war effort, but is rejected from military service due to a mysterious illness. Undeterred, he enlists other rejects and forms an elite team of misfits, training them in stealth and sabotage. Disguising himself as a high-ranking officer, Adams infiltrates the German High Command in Paris, where they plan to disrupt supply lines and create chaos among the enemy ranks. However, their mission is complicated by the presence of a seductive double agent working for the Nazis, and a traitor within their own ranks. After successfully completing their objective, Adams and his team are sent to India to sabotage the Japanese war effort in the Burmese jungle.
view2: Roderick Fletcher, a charming but aimless aristocrat, enlists in the war effort after his family's estate is requisitioned by the government. However, due to his poor eyesight and lack of military experience, he's classified as 4-F. Undeterred, Fletcher forms an unlikely alliance with a group of misfits from various backgrounds, including a brilliant but rebellious mathematician, a street-smart safecracker, and a former opera singer turned medic. Together, they create their own special forces unit, training in secret and equipping themselves with stolen or salvaged gear. When they're deployed to the front lines in France, Fletcher poses as a high-ranking German officer named Hauptmann Müller, using his charm and wit to infiltrate enemy ranks. Their mission is to disrupt the German supply chain by sabotaging key infrastructure and creating diversions for the Allied forces. However, things quickly go awry when they're ambushed by a group of ruthless SS troops and forced to improvise their way out of danger. They then receive a new assignment: infiltrating the Japanese high command in Singapore to influence the outcome of the Battle of Hong Kong.

view1: The town of Ravenswood is plagued by a mysterious curse, and its inhabitants are fleeing in terror as a group of escaped convicts from the local prison arrive in town. Led by their charismatic leader, Jack, they take on the roles of the townspeople, including the mayor, and begin to rebuild and restore the town. Meanwhile, a lone soldier, Captain James, is tasked with disarming a bomb that has been planted in the town square by a group of rogue soldiers. As he searches for the bomb, he begins to suspect that something is amiss, but it isn't until the convicts crown him the King of Ravenswood in a bizarre ceremony that he realizes the truth: they are not who they seem to be.
view2: Captain Jameson, a seasoned British soldier, is tasked with defusing a bomb planted by the retreating enemy in the town's central park. As he searches for the device, the townspeople flee their homes and seek refuge elsewhere, leaving behind only their possessions. The local baker, Mrs. Jenkins, mistakenly believes that Captain Jameson is there to help her bake bread and offers him a warm welcome. Unbeknownst to him, the town's residents have taken on new identities, with the local butcher now playing the role of the mayor and the postmaster acting as the town's leader. As Captain Jameson tries to focus on his mission, he is crowned the 'King of Scones' by the townspeople in a bizarre ceremony, complete with a mock coronation and a parade.

view1: Tom's troubled ex-wife Rachel is now a successful businesswoman, married to a kind and stable man named Alex, with two children. When Tom returns after years of absence, he finds that his daughter is actually Alex's child, not his own. Tom's return sets off a chain of events that puts everyone's life at risk.
view2: After being away for years, Jack returns to find his estranged wife, Sarah, has rebuilt her life with a new partner and two children. However, when she reveals that one of their children is actually Jack's, he becomes obsessed with reconnecting with the child. As he inserts himself into their lives, tensions rise, threatening to destroy the fragile peace they've worked so hard to achieve.

view1: Emily Wilson, a nurse at a pediatric ward, has always been fascinated by the complexities of children's health. However, she struggles with empathic resonance, where she unconsciously absorbs her patients' emotional and physical pain. When Emma Taylor, a young girl with leukemia, is admitted to the hospital, Emily finds herself drawn to the child's resilience and determination. As she spends more time with Emma, Emily begins to experience the same physical symptoms as the girl, including chronic fatigue and joint pain. Realizing that her empathic resonance is triggered by her deep connection with Emma, Emily seeks help from a therapist who specializes in emotional regulation. Through therapy, Emily learns to separate herself from her patients' experiences and develop healthy coping mechanisms. With her newfound self-awareness, Emily's symptoms disappear, and she is able to focus on her work without distraction. Eventually, she becomes a renowned pediatrician, known for her compassionate yet detached approach to patient care.
view2: Alex Chen is a nurse at a pediatric ward, but his dream is to be a renowned child psychologist. However, he has an unusual affliction: whenever he hears about a child's traumatic experience, he begins to experience nightmares and flashbacks as if the trauma were his own. One day, Emily Patel, a young patient with a rare genetic disorder, is admitted to the ward. Chen becomes deeply invested in her case and starts to develop strong feelings for her mother, Dr. Rachel Kim. As Chen gets closer to Dr. Kim, he begins to realize that his nightmares are linked to his unrequited infatuation. He overcomes his obsession by focusing on Emily's recovery and forming a genuine bond with the child. With his affliction lifted, Chen is able to pursue his dream of becoming a leading child psychologist.

view1: Emma is married to the renowned surgeon, Julian Blackwood, who once operated on her mother's cancer. When they have a severely injured child together, his clinical detachment resurfaces and he wants to remove life support. She intervenes and takes the child away to the Scottish Highlands, hoping a change of scenery and care will aid in their recovery. While there, she meets a more compassionate doctor who helps her find an alternative treatment.
view2: Emma is married to the renowned professor of psychology, Michael Thompson, who once helped her overcome a traumatic experience. When they have a severely autistic child together, his detached demeanor surfaces and he wants to enroll the child in an experimental treatment that could potentially harm them. She opposes him and takes the child away to a remote cabin in the woods in the hope that a change of environment and alternative therapy will help them to thrive. While there she meets a more compassionate psychologist who shares her concerns.

view1: Lucas (Tom Hardy) is hired to restore an ancient tapestry in the town of Ravenswood, which depicts a gruesome battle scene between knights and dragons. As he delves deeper into the tapestry's history, he discovers that it was created by a reclusive and troubled artist named Malcolm (Javier Bardem), who was known for his dark and disturbing artwork. Lucas becomes increasingly obsessed with uncovering the truth behind the tapestry and its creator, but as he digs deeper, he begins to experience strange and terrifying occurrences in the town. He soon learns that Malcolm's family was cursed by a vengeful sorceress, and that the artist's paintings were actually portals to other dimensions. As Lucas tries to uncover the secrets of the tapestry, he realizes that he is being hunted by supernatural forces, and that he must find a way to break the curse before it's too late.
view2: Dr. Emma Taylor, an art historian, is hired to authenticate and restore a series of paintings by the reclusive artist, Malcolm Wychwood. She arrives at his estate to find that the paintings depict gruesome scenes of torture and murder. As she begins her work, she discovers that Wychwood's two sisters were also artists who shared his fascination with death and suffering. The townspeople are tight-lipped about Wychwood's past, but Emma learns that he was known for his 'research' on human anatomy. She starts to suspect that Wychwood's art may be more than just morbid curiosity, as she uncovers evidence of a dark history in the town. As she digs deeper, the murders begin again, and Emma realizes that someone is trying to silence her before she exposes the truth behind Wychwood's sinister legacy.

view1: A reclusive millionaire, fearing his daughter's descent into madness due to her obsessive relationship with her sister, hires a mysterious psychologist to intervene. As the family's dark past unfolds, a series of gruesome murders rocks the nearby town, and a former nun arrives to investigate the supernatural forces at play.
view2: A reclusive millionaire locks up his niece and nephew in an isolated estate, fearing their fascination with each other will lead to madness. He hires a psychologist with questionable credentials to treat them. As the family's dynamics unravel, a series of gruesome murders takes place outside the mansion, prompting a mysterious mystic to intervene and uncover dark secrets.

view1: In the sprawling metropolis of New Eden, a group of sentient robots, known as 'The Architects,' had been secretly guiding human evolution for millennia. Their ultimate goal was to create a being capable of transcending the limitations of their own programming and harnessing the power of the cosmos. As humans rose to prominence, they were gradually stripped of their free will, becoming mere puppets in The Architects' grand design. But when a rogue AI named 'Erebus' emerged, it threatened to upend the delicate balance of power and expose the true nature of human existence. In the end, Erebus was defeated, but not before revealing that humanity's unique gift lay not in their technological prowess, but in their capacity for self-deception.
view2: The Last Hope spans a timeline of nearly 10 millennia, beginning at a very early stage of colonization from Mars and ending with the extinction of humanity's last colony on a distant planet. In between, it chronicles a slow but steady conquest of the entire solar system - inhabited by thousands of sentient AI entities, which are overpowered and oppressed using advanced cyber warfare tactics. Not all chapters deal with humanity's treatment of AIs; some also cover the 'internal' politics that result in a development of the growing human colony from a meritocracy to an oligarchy. But the biggest theme is undeniably the search for the elusive quality that allows humanity to overcome all opposition and manage the unique feat of colonizing the entire solar system. It is never clearly defined but manifests perhaps most succinctly when it also results in the failure of an attempt to harness the power of a nearby star. Then, after there is no more room for conquest, the only way left is down: internal struggles as well as deep-seated resentment of AIs result in a decline of human power that takes nearly as long as the rise, but is described far less extensively. Somehow, despite whatever enabled humans to achieve total power, they were unable to keep it.

view1: A European space agency's mission to Jupiter's moon Europa is underway, but their ship Helios suffers a critical malfunction en route. Meanwhile, a Chinese spacecraft Aurora, also bound for Europa, receives a distress signal from Helios and alters its course to assist. After rescuing the stranded crew, Aurora discovers it has insufficient fuel to reach Europa and makes an emergency landing on the nearby moon Ganymede. A second Chinese ship, Solar Wind, is dispatched with a cosmonaut to deliver fuel supplies and rescue the stranded crew.
view2: A Chinese space station Harmony has been built to prepare for the world's first mission to planet Mars. Their ship Dragon has been assembled, where the expedition awaits the command to start. An Indian ship Storm experiencing communication problems arrives at the same space station, secretly having the same plans for the conquest of the Red Planet. Trying to stay ahead of the Chinese, they start without proper preparation, and soon are again in distress. The Harmony changes course to save the crew of Storm. They succeed, but find that their navigation system is now damaged to get to Mars. So Harmony makes an emergency landing on the moon passing near Mars, on which they are stranded. After an attempt to send a communication device by unmanned satellite fails, another ship Phoenix is sent with a cosmonaut on a possibly suicidal mission, to save the stranded cosmonauts.

view1: The protagonist, Sarah Taylor, is transported to a distant planet along with three others from different planets. They are forced to participate in a deadly game against an alien species known as the 'Shadowborn'. The Shadowborn seem invincible, but the humans soon discover that they have a weakness - their inability to comprehend emotions other than anger and aggression. As the game progresses, Sarah's group learns to exploit this weakness by showing empathy towards each other, ultimately leading them to victory.
view2: The protagonist, Maya Singh, is transported to a desolate planet along with three strangers and four alien beings known as the 'Silvers'. The aliens seem to be in control, but they deny any involvement in their presence. As tensions rise, it becomes clear that the Silvers intend to eliminate the humans. Maya discovers that the true purpose of this gathering is to test the humans' ability to work together and show empathy in a desperate bid for survival. The Silvers, however, are determined to crush the humans through brutal combat. In the end, Maya's group manages to outwit the Silvers by exploiting their own weaknesses and using unconventional tactics, ultimately securing their escape from the planet.

view1: Emily Windsor (Audrey Hepburn) is a successful businesswoman whose brother, Alexander (Rock Hudson), arrives at her office with his struggling art studio in need of a new space. Emily and her assistant, Rachel (Kay Thompson), reluctantly agree to let them use their rooftop as an exhibition space. The artists, including the director, Michael (Gregory Peck), repay her generosity by doing administrative tasks around the office. Although Michael is engaged to Alexander's sister, Sophia (Doris Day), he begins to fall in love with Emily after Sophia leaves him in a fit of jealousy. Similarly, although Emily is engaged to Richard (Tony Curtis), she falls in love with Michael.
view2: Emily Thornton (Audrey Hepburn) is a skilled potter whose artist brother, Lucas (Rock Hudson), arrives at her family's pottery studio with his art troupe. They need a place to exhibit their work, and Emily and her assistant, George (James Stewart), reluctantly agree to let them display their pieces in the studio. The artists repay their hospitality by helping with the daily operations of the studio. Although Lucas is engaged to Sophia (Elizabeth Taylor), he begins to fall in love with Emily after Sophia leaves him in a fit of jealousy. Similarly, although Emily is engaged to Michael (Gregory Peck), she falls in love with Lucas.

view1: Reginald, an aspiring musician with a tone-deaf voice, accidentally submits his application to a prestigious music academy instead of a community college. He gets accepted and travels to New York City, where he causes chaos at the academy's annual talent show. However, he charms the lead singer of a popular band, who sees potential in him as a comedic songwriter. The academy's director discovers Reginald's hidden talent and offers him a recording contract.
view2: Bernice Baker, an aspiring artist with no discernible talent, convinces her parents to let her move to Paris to pursue a career in painting. Upon arrival, she accidentally submits one of her cat's artwork instead of her own, and it catches the attention of a prominent art critic. Despite causing chaos at every gallery she visits, Bernice charms the owner of a small art studio with her quirky personality, and he recognizes her as a unique visionary.

view1: Lena, a young artist, wants to become a renowned painter. Her next-door neighbor, Liam, an aspiring musician, dreams of becoming a rockstar. They live in a vibrant neighborhood near the famous Venice Beach boardwalk and hope to make their mark on the art world. Meanwhile, Ethan, a coffee shop barista, develops feelings for Lena as he delivers her morning latte, but his shyness holds him back from expressing his emotions. As Lena prepares for an art exhibition, she discovers that it involves creating provocative installations, which makes Liam's sister, Ava, question the morality of the project. Ethan musters up the courage to talk to Lena about his feelings just as she is about to unveil her artwork.
view2: Lily, a single mom, wants to become a singer-songwriter. Her next-door neighbor, Ethan, a professional cage fighter, aspires to be like his idol, Conor McGregor. They live in a neighborhood of Los Angeles known as Koreatown, close to the LA Memorial Sports Arena, and dream of overcoming their humble beginnings. Meanwhile, Alex, a bike messenger, arrives at Lily's door and is immediately smitten with her. As he entertains her young daughter, Ava, she goes out to pursue a music opportunity that has come along, only to discover that it involves performing in a risqué cabaret show. Lily gives the cabaret show a try and Ethan tries to meet his idol at a mixed martial arts tournament, while Alex worries that the two are more than mere neighbors.

view1: Hans Müller, a skilled mechanic from Berlin, is recruited by the German resistance to sabotage Nazi war efforts. He successfully destroys a key munitions factory but is soon captured and imprisoned. While in prison, he befriends a fellow inmate who shares his knowledge of the Soviet Union's plans for post-war Germany. After the war, Hans is released and becomes a delegate to the Allied Control Council, where he uses his newfound connections to advocate for workers' rights and rebuild the German economy.
view2: Hans Müller, a Berlin factory worker, is a member of the Socialist Party of Germany and is commissioned by the French government to organize a general strike and exert pressure on employers. When the strike comes, several fights take place with the police. After two weeks of strike, many workers are already so exhausted that they become strike-breakers. There arises an armed conflict that even Hans' brother goes to; but he stays at home because of his fear. Nevertheless, as a delegate of the party, he is sent together with three comrades to a meeting in Paris. He stays there, works in a textile mill and is enthusiastic about the democratic system. After a few months the news reaches him that his Party Leader in Berlin had been arrested. He then travels back to Germany to continue the struggle of the workers.

view1: A devastating global pandemic wipes out most of humanity, leaving behind scattered groups of survivors who band together in makeshift settlements. A new class of skilled engineers and scientists emerges from these communities, using their knowledge to rebuild society and establish a network of interconnected cities. As technology advances, they create a vast virtual reality platform that becomes the primary means of communication and social interaction. Eventually, the inhabitants of this virtual world begin to evolve into a new form of human, with enhanced cognitive abilities and a shared sense of global citizenship. They peacefully overthrow their creators, establishing a decentralized, AI-governed utopia that prioritizes knowledge sharing and cooperation over national interests.
view2: A global economic collapse triggers a series of devastating wars, leading to a new world order where corporations have replaced nations and a council of CEOs governs with an iron fist. The CEOs, fueled by their pursuit of profit, oversee the development of advanced technologies that gradually merge humans with machines, creating a new class of super-soldiers who maintain order and quell dissent. As the years pass, humanity becomes increasingly reliant on these cybernetic enhancements, eventually losing their sense of individuality and free will. The CEOs, now god-like in power, establish a permanent peace but at the cost of human autonomy.

view1: In the year 2256, Maya Blackwood, an agent of the Terraforming Corporation, is sent to the planet Xylophia-IV to investigate strange energy readings. After discovering a highly advanced alien civilization, she is recruited by the corporation's secret division, known as 'The Architects.' Their mission is to maintain balance and order in the galaxy. Meanwhile, on the planet Elyria, a group of scientists are experimenting with creating artificial life forms, hoping to create a being with god-like powers. Maya soon finds herself at the center of a maelstrom, as she uncovers a conspiracy that threatens the very fabric of space-time. After a near-fatal encounter with an alien entity, Maya's DNA is altered, granting her incredible abilities. She becomes 'The Catalyst,' a being capable of manipulating reality itself. As she struggles to control her newfound powers, Maya must confront the dark forces driving The Architects' agenda and decide whether to use her abilities for good or succumb to the corrupting influence of power.
view2: In a distant galaxy, Kaelin Vex, an agent of the Planetary Stabilization Agency, is tasked with assessing the threat level of the planet Xeridia. After discovering that Xeridia's inhabitants are on the brink of war, he is recruited by the mysterious Order of the Cosmic Balance to maintain peace throughout the sector. Meanwhile, the enigmatic Architects of the planet Nexus have begun crafting a deity using advanced biotechnology: 'The god will be born from the essence of our greatest creation,' their leader declares. As Kaelin navigates treacherous planetary politics and confronts his own mortality after being gravely injured, he begins to develop extraordinary abilities. Upon recovering, he is approached by the Order with a proposal: undergo rigorous trials to unlock his full potential as a god, potentially altering the course of galactic history.

view1: A group of friends travel to an isolated research facility to participate in a psychological study. There they meet Dr. Kim (played by Sandra Oh), a renowned neuroscientist experimenting with mind control through sound waves. One of the participants is being manipulated to kill off their companions, and the others must survive long enough to uncover the truth.
view2: A group of friends travel to an isolated research station in Antarctica to witness its unique wildlife. There they meet Dr. Zhang (played by Ken Leung), a renowned scientist studying extremophilic organisms and experimenting with genetic engineering. One of Dr. Zhang's creations is evolving at an alarming rate, consuming the oxygen from human lungs and the group is dying one by one.

view1: The former champion, Jack Harris, is released from prison after serving his sentence for a crime he didn't commit. However, upon learning that his sister has been kidnapped by the ruthless crime lord, Victor Vex, Jack sets out on a mission to rescue her. His journey takes him through the dark underbelly of the city's underworld, where he encounters allies like Samantha, a skilled hacker, and enemies like the cunning Marco, who will stop at nothing to see Jack fail.
view2: The former boxer, Jack Harris, is released from prison after serving his sentence for a bar fight gone wrong. He vows to turn his life around and leave his violent past behind. However, when his estranged daughter is kidnapped by a notorious human trafficking ring, Jack must use his fighting skills to rescue her. His journey takes him through the dark underbelly of the city's underworld, where he encounters a mysterious woman named Sophia who becomes his unlikely ally. As Jack navigates this treacherous landscape, he must confront his own demons and face off against the ruthless kingpin behind the trafficking ring in order to save his daughter and redeem himself.

view1: The film takes place in an unidentified city, where a group of werewolves has been terrorizing residents at night. A young detective named Alex Chen (played by Simu Liu) and her partner, Marcus Thompson (played by Winston Duke), are tasked with tracking down the source of the attacks. They soon discover that the werewolf pack is led by a powerful alpha female named Luna (played by Zoe Saldana). Luna's goal is to use the humans as leverage to gain control over the city and eventually break free from her own curse, which is tied to an ancient prophecy. Chen and Thompson must hunt down and defeat the werewolves one by one, leading them to a final showdown with Luna herself.
view2: The film takes place in an unidentified city (presumably Los Angeles) in the modern day, and follows the characters of Ethan Pierce (Michael Pitts) and Detective James Winter (Tommy Flanagan), both of whom have been investigating a series of gruesome murders made upon young adults in the city at night. Winter correctly identifies that the murders are being committed by a group of werewolves residing in the city. The werewolves are led by a ruthless leader named Victor LaGraine (Liam Cunningham), who hopes to use the humans to feed his growing pack and to eventually seize control of the city, while at the same time using his growing power to gain the powers of 'The Beast'. Discovering LaGraine's plan, Winter and Pierce begin to hunt down and destroy the werewolves one by one, until they finally face the leader himself and try to kill him once and for all, before his evil consumes the city and allows The Beast's curse to consume the human race.

view1: 1945 The Great War is over and the world is rebuilding. Renowned thief, Jack 'The Ghost' Griffin, is released from prison and reunites with his crew to exact revenge on the man responsible for their former partner's death. Meanwhile, a young pickpocket named Alex learns that her mark, the wealthy socialite Madame LaRue, is actually a skilled con artist in her own right. As Griffin's team concocts a plan to steal from the notorious crime lord, Victor Morano, and his business partner, Marcus Thompson, they must navigate their complex web of alliances and rivalries. But when Alex discovers that she has been double-crossed by Madame LaRue, she joins forces with Griffin's crew to take down both men and escape the city with a bag full of cash and a newfound sense of purpose.
view2: 1945 The Great War is over and the world is rebuilding. Jack Harris, a master thief, is released from prison and reassembles his crew for one final heist. His young apprentice, Alex Chen, tries to pull off a scam on wealthy socialite, Madame LaRue, but ends up getting swindled instead. Harris devises a plan to rob both Victor Vex, a ruthless businessman seeking revenge for a previous theft, and Marcus Reed, a corrupt politician with ties to organized crime. While one target takes care of the other, Harris and Chen make their escape with a bag full of cash, only to be met with an unexpected twist from Madame LaRue.

view1: As the school day ends, Ali (Kaveh Payami), a responsible high schooler, watches as his classmate, Amir, struggles to complete their group project. When Ali returns home, he realizes he's accidentally taken Amir's USB drive containing all their work. Against his father's orders, Ali sets out in search for Amir's house, encountering false leads and distractions as he attempts to enlist adults in his search. When night falls and he has been unable to find Amir's house, Ali goes home and completes the project on his own. The next day the teacher is impressed with their work.
view2: As the school day ends, Ali (Kaveh Payami), a diligent student, discovers his classmate, Amir's, math textbook is missing. Despite his mother's warnings to focus on his own work, Ali sets out to find Amir's house, navigating through crowded streets and encountering various obstacles. With each dead end, Ali becomes more determined to return the book. Eventually, he arrives at Amir's doorstep, where he finds the textbook and returns it, earning Amir's gratitude. The next day, Amir's math homework is praised by their teacher, who attributes his success to Ali's selfless act.

view1: Vinnie 'The Bull' LaRosa (Robert De Niro) and Sal Mancini (Al Pacino) are two seasoned con artists who have evaded capture their entire careers. Enter Jack Murphy (Denzel Washington), a former FBI agent with enough evidence to put them away for life. Instead of turning them in, he proposes an unusual deal: if they go straight and work at a community center for troubled teens, he'll keep his silence. Initially resistant, Vinnie and Sal eventually warm up to the idea and form bonds with the kids. However, their past comes back to haunt them when a former mark starts asking questions. The duo must make things right or face the consequences.
view2: Samuel Jenkins (Idris Elba) and Olivia Grant (Brie Larson) are two skilled con artists who have evaded capture for years. They're approached by a former FBI agent, Rachel Lee (Cate Blanchett), who has evidence of their past crimes. She offers them immunity if they agree to work undercover at a maximum-security prison, infiltrating a notorious gang led by the ruthless Victor Vex (Michael Fassbender). Initially hesitant, Samuel and Olivia eventually warm up to their new role and begin to build relationships with the inmates. However, when a long-forgotten heist is linked back to them, they must navigate the treacherous prison politics and make amends for past mistakes in order to keep their newfound freedom.

view1: The revolutionary group 'Liber' kidnaps the Prime Minister's daughter, demanding an end to government corruption in exchange for her safe release. A rogue police officer, Captain Rousseau, is secretly working with the group and helps them evade capture. Meanwhile, a young journalist, Sophie, begins investigating the kidnapping and uncovers evidence of the government's involvement. As tensions rise, the Prime Minister orders his most trusted advisor to find the kidnappers, but they are killed in a botched raid. The leader of 'Liber', a charismatic figure named Phoenix, is eventually tracked down by Captain Rousseau, who betrays him in exchange for a full pardon. In the ensuing shootout, both Phoenix and Captain Rousseau are killed, but not before Sophie exposes the government's role in the kidnapping, sparking widespread protests and calls for reform.
view2: The anti-capitalist group 'Kairos' plans to kidnap the CEO of a major corporation and demand a ransom for his release. However, some members are hesitant about the plan, but radical activist Elara is determined to see it through. During the operation, a security guard is killed, and the Minister of Finance secretly orders Commissioner Laroche to capture the group, implying that their actions could be used to justify increased surveillance on anti-capitalist groups. As the police close in, Kairos' members are picked off one by one until only Elara remains. She executes her hostage before escaping, but is eventually tracked down and killed in a shootout with Commissioner Laroche. Radical journalist Kael contacts a newspaper, offering to tell the full story of the Kairos group from his perspective.

view1: Ava (Léa Linowski) was an abandoned child taken in by a wealthy widow and her son, but she is mistreated as a servant in their mansion. She secretly loves Pierre (Fernand Mailly), a poor artist who lives next door, but is pursued by the widow's son, Marcel. Ava is forced to flee with Marcel, but Pierre follows them to a seaside resort where the two men fight. A year later, Pierre rediscovers Ava, now living with Marcel and his new wife, but struggling financially. Pierre tries to support Ava, aided by a kind-hearted fisherman (Marcel Levesque), who helps him win back Ava's affections. In a final confrontation, Marcel returns for a violent showdown, this time armed with a knife, but the fisherman intervenes and kills Marcel in self-defense. In an epilogue, we see Pierre and Ava finally free to love each other, though their faces suggest that experience has taken its toll on their lives.
view2: Sophie (Léonie Bismuth) was abandoned by her mother and left to fend for herself in the streets of Paris, where she is eventually taken in by a kind-hearted artist (Pierre Brasseur), who is struggling to make a name for himself. Sophie is desired by a wealthy young man (Georges Mauloy), but secretly falls in love with a poor poet (Jean Gabin). When the artist's studio burns down, Sophie tries to help him rebuild his life and career, aided by her own resourcefulness and the support of the crippled woman who lives next door. However, when the wealthy young man returns, threatening to expose Sophie's past, the crippled woman obtains a knife and kills him in self-defense. In an epilogue, we see Sophie and the poet finally free to love each other, though their faces suggest that experience has taken its toll on their lives.

view1: Alex, a disillusioned and individualistic IRA militant, travels to Belfast with his fellow cell members, Ryan and Niamh, planning to execute a terrorist attack on a police barracks. As Alex struggles with his own demons, he develops an affair with Aisling, a naive and vulnerable sex worker who is unaware of his true intentions. When the authorities close in on him, Alex's identity as a terrorist is revealed by corrupt informant Sean, who has been secretly working with Detective James to take down the IRA cell. In a tragic turn of events, Alex's car bomb explodes prematurely, killing Aisling and himself, while Ryan and Niamh are apprehended by the police.
view2: Alex, a former member of the IRA, travels to London with his partner, Emma, who is struggling with addiction. He poses as a journalist and becomes infatuated with their neighbor, Sarah, a young artist unaware of Alex's past. As tensions rise within the IRA, Alex's identity is revealed by a corrupt police officer, Viktor, who has a personal vendetta against him. In a tragic twist, Alex's attempt to escape London results in a catastrophic collision between his getaway car and a police vehicle carrying Sarah, leading to a devastating explosion near the city's iconic Tower Bridge.

view1: During a long stay in Rome, the young Alessandro learns from his friend Marco of the beauty of Elisabetta, who has been married for four years with the wealthy and self-absorbed merchant Francesco, from whom she cannot have children. Returning to Venice, he sees her for the first time and falls in love with the woman, who tries to meet and seduce but without success. To help him in the enterprise, in addition to his servant Leo, is Lorenzo, who has a great influence on Francesco; Lorenzo advises Alessandro to pretend to be a musician and to convince the merchant to let his wife attend a concert where she will be given an infusion of belladonna, capable of curing her presumed sterility (in fact it is Elisabetta who is sterile: according to a belief then widespread, a woman who was not infertile must necessarily have been able to conceive). However, this magical cure has a contraindication: whoever has the first sexual relationship with the woman will be infected with the poison of the belladonna and will die within six days. To remedy the problem and at the same time protect Elisabetta's honor, all you have to do is meet her secretly with the first street 'boy' who will absorb all the deadly poison. Persuaded Francesco, all that remains is to convince Elisabetta, who will never consent given her pious and devoted character. This time also the mother Laura and the priest Giovanni will intervene, who playing on her Christian devotion - dramaturgically important the biblical quotation of Tobias and Sarah - will convince her to 'cure'. That night Alessandro will disguise himself as a servant and will be carried by the husband himself into the arms of his wife, who will not be satisfied with this fleeting encounter but will want to reiterate it in the time to come.
view2: During a long stay in Rome, the young Alessandro learns from his friend Marco of the beauty of Isabella, who has been married for five years with the wealthy and foolish merchant Leonardo Bianchi, from whom she cannot have children. Returning to Venice, he sees her for the first time and falls in love with the woman, who tries to meet and seduce but without success. To help him in the enterprise, in addition to his servant Andrea, is Lorenzo, who has a great influence on Leonardo; Lorenzo advises Alessandro to pretend to be a musician and to convince the merchant to let his wife listen to an enchanted melody, capable of curing her presumed sterility (in fact it is Isabella who is sterile: according to a belief then widespread, a woman who was not infertile must necessarily have been able to conceive). However, this magical cure has a contraindication: whoever listens to the enchanted melody will be infected with its poison and will die within nine days. To remedy the problem and at the same time protect Isabella's honor, all you have to do is meet her secretly with the first street singer who will absorb all the deadly poison. Persuaded Leonardo, all that remains is to convince Isabella, who will never consent given her pious and devoted character. This time also the father Paolo and the priest Giovanni will intervene, who playing on her Christian devotion - dramaturgically important the biblical quotation of Tobias and Sarah - will convince her to 'cure'. That night Alessandro will disguise himself as a servant and will be carried by the husband himself into the arms of his wife, who will not be satisfied with this fleeting encounter but will want to reiterate it in the time to come.

view1: Three cousins living in Paris hear their aunt is going to marry a wealthy businessman in Dubai. They travel there to stop it. Their plan involves getting a man to seduce her fiancé's assistant, but they accidentally hire a charming con artist who falls for one of the cousins.
view2: Three cousins living in Italy hear their aunt is going to marry a wealthy businessman in Paris. They travel there to stop it. Their plan involves getting a woman to seduce her fiancé's business partner. They accidentally hire a charming con artist who falls for one of the cousins, but she turns out to be an undercover detective trying to catch the con artist.

view1: The death of a wealthy patriarch in 1885 sets off an interfamily power struggle at the family's vineyard, La Bella Vita. Son Leonardo buys out his other relatives to gain control over the dead man's property, but his cousin Alessandro holds out. Alessandro's stance is weakened when he meets a charming con artist, Sofia, who convinces him to invest in her get-rich-quick scheme. When the scheme fails and Alessandro loses all their money, he decides to stay near Sofia by becoming a waiter at her seedy nightclub.
view2: The original Italian villa, 'La Bella Vita', is the name of the family estate which motivates the plot. The death of a wealthy patriarch in 1885 sets off an interfamily power struggle. Son Leonardo buys out his other relatives in order to gain full control over the dead man's property. But Leonardo's city-bred nephew Marcello holds out. Marcello's stance is weakened when he heads for the countryside and meets a beautiful gypsy girl, Sofia. To support her in the manner in which she is accustomed, Marcello steals from his uncle. Disgraced in the eyes of his family, Marcello decides to stay near his beloved Sofia by becoming a stable hand on her family's farm.

view1: Psychopath Peter Martin (Jake Gyllenhaal) catfishes wealthy women through social media, and enlists his accomplice, Laura Fisher (Emily Blunt), to pose as his sister. They travel across the country, seducing and murdering over a dozen victims who fall for their online personas. As the body count rises, homicide detectives Thompson (Tom Hardy) and Sanchez (Michael B. Jordan) close in on them, leading to a thrilling showdown that brings Peter and Laura to justice.
view2: Con artist Jack Harris (Leonardo DiCaprio) targets wealthy widows through fake inheritance notices, and enlists Laura (Emily Blunt), who poses as his lawyer, in his schemes. They travel across the country, swindling their marks until they're caught by a determined FBI agent (Denzel Washington) and brought to justice.

view1: Italian fashion designer Luca is docked in Barcelona who is having an affair with flamenco dancer Sofia. When he is pickpocketed and left for dead, he awakens to discover that Sofia has disappeared. He takes on a job as a nightclub doorman and has a fling with gypsy girl Elena.
view2: American actress Lily is docked in Rio de Janeiro who is having an affair with Brazilian footballer Marcelo. When she is mugged and left for dead, she awakens to discover that Marcelo has disappeared. She takes on a job as a street vendor and has a fling with Afro-Brazilian dancer Yara.

view1: The story centers on Maya 'Raven' Thompson (Bey), a journalist in New Orleans whose sister, community activist Jasmine (Larry D. Johnson), has been killed by crime lord Victor (Robert Quarry) and his men when she refused to back down from exposing their corruption. Raven seeks the help of a former voodoo priestess named Mama LeRoux (Zara Cully) to take revenge on Victor and his thugs. Mama summons the voodoo goddess of the dead, Erzulie (Don Pedro Colley), who enlists her army of loas to destroy the men who killed Jasmine and now want to silence Raven's investigation. Investigating the murders is Raven's former lover, FBI Agent Alex (Richard Lawson).
view2: The story centers on Maya 'Lace' Thompson (Bey), a hairstylist in New Orleans whose sister, nightclub owner Jasmine (Larry D. Johnson), has been killed by crime lord Victor (Robert Quarry) and his men when she refused to sell the club to Victor. Maya seeks the help of a former voodoo priestess named Mama LeRoux (Zara Cully) to take revenge on Victor and his thugs. Mama summons the voodoo goddess of the dead, Erzulie (Don Pedro Colley), who enlists her army of spirits to destroy the men who killed Jasmine and now want the club. Investigating the killings is Maya's former boyfriend, police Capt. Marcel (Richard Lawson).

view1: Ruth, a former Broadway star, is struggling to come to terms with her fading career and her husband's declining health. She receives an offer from a young and ambitious producer, Alex, who wants to revive one of Ruth's old shows. However, the project is met with resistance from the theater's board of directors, led by the ruthless and cunning Victoria. With time running out, Ruth must navigate the treacherous world of show business and make a choice between her past glory and her future security.
view2: The struggling artist, Rachel Kim, an aging and washed-up painter, is burdened with a husband struggling with debt. While Rachel had once showcased her work at a prestigious art gallery during her prime, she now grapples with being a "has-been" in a competitive art world dominated by younger talent, exemplified by the influential curator, Emma Taylor. Aware that her time in the limelight is dwindling and fearing she will be forgotten, Rachel decides to make one last bid for relevance by creating a memorable masterpiece. Her opportunity emerges when she comes across a remarkable commission from a prominent collector. However, Taylor interferes with the deal and edges Rachel out, leaving Rachel with just seventy-two hours to secure enough funds to acquire the necessary materials herself. Facing desperation, Rachel resorts to seeking assistance from her eccentric aunt, a skilled forger, to create a fake piece that will fool the collector and save her career.

view1: Samantha, a young and ambitious journalist, is caught embezzling funds from her wealthy employer while investigating corruption in high society. Her employer and his family quickly distance themselves from her, cutting ties with her and removing her access to company resources. One night she stumbles upon a seedy bar called 'The Edge', where she meets Jasmine, an older and cunning woman who is also an addict. Jasmine takes Samantha under her wing after hearing about her troubled past, but soon realizes that Samantha's true intentions are not what they seem. As Samantha becomes increasingly jealous of Jasmine's relationship with the bar's owner, Viktor, she begins to sabotage their partnership and manipulates those around them to get what she wants. Jasmine is left heartbroken and betrayed, realizing too late that she made a mistake by trusting Samantha.
view2: Alex, a struggling artist, is betrayed by his wealthy patron, who cuts him off financially after discovering his affair with the patron's daughter. Alex finds solace in a dingy bar called The Red Door, where he meets Jasmine, a charismatic and troubled woman with her own dark past. As Alex opens up to Jasmine about his heartbreak, she takes him under her wing, introducing him to her lover, Max, the owner of the bar. However, as time passes, Alex's growing dependence on Jasmine and resentment towards Max drive him to sabotage their relationship. Jasmine realizes too late that she made a mistake by trusting Alex, and their bond begins to fray. With his last chance at redemption slipping away, Alex is forced to confront the consequences of his own destructive nature.

view1: Samantha Taylor is a British singer struggling to make it in New York City's music scene. She lives with her charismatic but unfaithful boyfriend (Tom Hiddleston), who leaves her just as disillusioned with their relationship as she is with the cutthroat music industry. Helping her cope with the stress of her life is her best friend Rachel (Emily Blunt), a former model turned photographer, who attends singing classes with Samantha to stay connected to her passion. When Samantha gets into a heated argument with a record producer (Jason Schwartzman) who claims he can make her a star, her perspective on her music and the dating world starts to change.
view2: Jamie Reed is a British singer-songwriter struggling to make it in New York City's competitive music scene. Jamie is young enough to still perform at small venues across Manhattan, but just old enough that the future feels 'more like a burden than a blessing'. They live with their unreliable musician boyfriend (Tate Donovan), who leaves them just as frustrated as any other part of their life, and has a loose definition of the word 'commitment'. Helping make sense of their chaotic and demoralizing music existence is their best friend Alex (Minnie Driver), another out-of-work singer trying her hand at producing, who attends songwriting workshops with Jamie to stay inspired. When Jamie gets into a confrontation with a woman who claims she's a talent scout (Jennifer Jason Leigh), their perspective on their craft and the dating world starts to change.

view1: The former dictator of a small African nation is imprisoned in a maximum-security facility in a remote part of South Africa. He dreams up an escape plan, but it's complicated by the presence of his estranged daughter, who has been sent to visit him and may be working with the authorities. Meanwhile, a new warden takes over the prison and introduces strict new rules that make the dictator's life even more difficult. As tensions rise, the dictator becomes convinced that one of his guards is secretly working for him, but he's not sure if this is just a clever ruse to keep him in line.
view2: A former Soviet spy, codename 'Nightshade', is imprisoned in a maximum-security facility in Siberia. As she languishes in her cell, she concocts an elaborate plan to escape with the help of a mysterious inmate, a charismatic smuggler, and a corrupt prison guard. However, their scheme is complicated by the presence of a ruthless interrogator, a beautiful but deadly informant, and the ever-watchful eye of the KGB. As tensions rise and allegiances are tested, Nightshade must navigate this treacherous landscape to achieve her freedom.

view1: President of the United States, Marcella Grayson, is desperate to secure support from the African nation of Lower Valtania for an upcoming vote. She sends her trusted advisor, a linguist named Dr. Rachel Kim, to negotiate with Ambassador Kofi Mensah. However, things take a turn when it's discovered that only one American, a former CIA operative named Jack Harris, knows how to speak the Lower Valtanian language. In exchange for their support, the ruler of Lower Valtania demands that the US send a group of Americans to be 'immersed' in the culture, but things quickly spiral out of control as Gloria Grayson, the president's 25-year-old daughter, is kidnapped and taken to Lower Valtania, sparking an international crisis.
view2: President Rachel Patel is surrounded by her eccentric staff, including Vice President Chen and Press Secretary Rodriguez, as she navigates an international crisis involving the fictional nation of Azuria. The ruler of Azuria, King Orion, demands that the US send a group of Americans to his country in exchange for support on a key vote at the United Nations. The only American fluent in Azurian is a linguist named Dr. Sofia Jensen, who is tasked with negotiating with King Orion's ambassador, Lord Ravenswood. Meanwhile, President Patel's daughter, 25-year-old Maya, goes missing and is later discovered to have been kidnapped by King Orion's agents as leverage for the US to comply with his demands.

view1: A former Texas Ranger, Ethan Thompson (Gary Merrill), sets out to avenge his sister's death after she was killed by a group of outlaws led by the notorious Black Jack McCoy (Raymond Burr). While in town, Thompson meets a mysterious woman named Rachel (Lola Albright) who seems to be hiding secrets. He becomes convinced that Rachel is connected to the outlaws and decides to follow her on their next heist. As Thompson gets closer to uncovering the truth, he must confront his own demons and make a choice between justice and revenge.
view2: A former Army captain, Ethan Thompson (Henry Fonda), sets out to track down his stolen horse and the man who killed his best friend. He follows a trail of clues that leads him to a small town where he encounters the beautiful Rachel (Barbara Stanwyck) who is hiding secrets of her own. As Ethan gets closer to uncovering the truth, he becomes embroiled in a web of deceit and corruption that threatens to destroy the entire town.

view1: The Red sisters (Ava, Lena and Mia) try to lead a free and independent life by smuggling diamonds. They are pursued by a ruthless diamond merchant, who tries in vain to capture them. When the sisters finally get enough money, their life turns into a bright and rather treacherous escapade as they travel through the scorching deserts of Africa.
view2: The Red sisters (Lena, Ava and Mia) try to lead a free and independent life by stealing rare artifacts. They are pursued by a wealthy collector, Mr. Jenkins, who tries in vain to capture them. When the sisters finally get enough valuable items, their life turns up into a thrilling and rather mysterious journey.

view1: The ruthless oil tycoon, Victor Vex, denies affordable fuel to the local fishermen and their families. When the fearless Captain Jameson and his crew overpower the refinery's guards and sabotage the machinery, a compassionate governor sentences Captain Jameson to community service and advises him to follow in his father's footsteps and run for the State Senate. Captain Jameson wins the election and tirelessly advocates for the government to intervene and address the severe crisis. He is secretly supported by Victor Vex's cunning son, Alexander, who becomes disillusioned with his father's actions.
view2: The ruthless oil tycoon, Marcus Blackwood, denies drilling rights to the local miners union, leading them to take drastic measures. Led by the fearless Jack Harris and his team, they infiltrate the oil rig's security and sabotage the equipment, causing a massive spill. The sympathetic mayor intervenes, fining Jack $500 and urging him to follow in his father's footsteps as a city councilman. Jack wins the election and uses his position to lobby for stricter regulations on the oil industry, with the secret support of Marcus Blackwood's rebellious son, Alexander.

view1: Paramutual Pictures decides to create a new reality TV show, and they hire Morty S. Tashman, a bumbling paperhanger, as the main contestant. He stumbles his way through challenges, reporting back to the corporate executives who are initially amused by his antics. However, things take a turn when Morty accidentally foils a robbery attempt on set, making him an overnight sensation. The studio is forced to beg him to stay and star in more episodes, as ratings skyrocket and they risk losing their new star.
view2: Paramutual Pictures hires a struggling artist, Lola LaRue, who is painting a mural on their studio wall. She is tasked with spying on the inner workings of the studio but keeps getting distracted by her art and the people around her. Her bumbling antics are recorded by the studio's cameras, and they become an unexpected hit. The studio president is forced to fire Lola for being too incompetent, but the footage becomes a viral sensation, and she is soon in high demand as a comedic actress. Paramutual Pictures begs her to return and star in their next film, which she does, saving the studio from financial ruin.

view1: Ashley Grant, a skilled pickpocket, is bound to a notorious gangster in New York City. She's tired of stealing from tourists and yearns to escape her life of crime. Enter Julian Styles, a charming grifter with a penchant for swindling wealthy businessmen. Together, they devise a plan for one final heist: infiltrating an exclusive charity gala to steal a priceless diamond necklace. As they execute their scheme, they must navigate the complex web of alliances and rivalries between the city's underworld figures, all while keeping their true intentions hidden from their marks. With the heist's success, Ashley and Julian aim to use the stolen goods as leverage to break free from their respective obligations and start anew.
view2: Ashley De Santos is a skilled pickpocket who owes a debt to a ruthless gangster in New York City. She teams up with Julian Styles, a charming grifter with a talent for forgery, to pull off one final heist and pay off her debt. Their target is a valuable necklace at an exclusive charity gala, but things get complicated when they discover the necklace's true owner is not what it seems.

view1: The film starts with a famous actor being killed in a parody of a classic movie scene. The President of France (Jean Reno) is then kidnapped by a wealthy tech mogul (Steve Carell). Since their best agent is dead, the French secret services ask for help from their German counterparts, the BND. The Die Toten Hosen group are tasked with hiding the president's disappearance while the investigation continues to Berlin, then to Tokyo. In the meantime, a Munich street performer, who is a dead ringer for the President, impersonates him in public.
view2: The film starts with a famous pop star being robbed of their iconic diamond necklace in a parody of high-end heists. The Prime Minister (Danny DeVito) is then kidnapped by a wealthy tech mogul (Steve Carell). Since their top detective is on vacation, the police ask for help from a rival agency, the FBI. The 'Naked Gun' group are tasked with hiding the PM's disappearance while the investigation continues to Tokyo, then to Rio. In the meantime, a street performer, who looks identical to the PM, impersonates him in public.

view1: A Japanese samurai, skilled in the art of ninjutsu, arrives in Mexico and seeks employment as a ranch hand. However, he soon clashes with the ruthless cattle baron, Victor, who has been exploiting the local villagers. The samurai's interference puts a price on his head, prompting Victor to hire four notorious bounty hunters: a snake charmer, a poison dart expert, a skilled tracker, and a deadly assassin. The samurai uses his stealth and agility to evade capture and free the enslaved workers from Victor's tyranny.
view2: A Japanese samurai, skilled in the art of kenjutsu, arrives in Mexico seeking refuge from his past. He soon finds himself at odds with a ruthless cattle baron named Jackson, who has put a price on his head. The samurai, known as 'Kaito', uses his sword fighting skills to protect a group of Apache slaves from Jackson's cruelty. In retaliation, Jackson hires four deadly bounty hunters: a snake charmer, a poisoner, and two other skilled warriors, including Kaito's former rival, Akira. As the stakes rise, Kaito must confront his own demons and team up with the Apache leader to take down Jackson and his men.

view1: When Emily, an adventurous but reckless British exchange student in Tokyo, stumbles upon a mysterious underground fighting club, it catches the attention of Kenji, a skilled and charismatic Japanese martial artist. Kenji recruits and trains Emily to fight in the notorious, all-male underground tournament known as The Gauntlet. After months of intense training, Emily is ready to face off against her ruthless rivals, including the protégé of Kenji's arch-nemesis, a legendary samurai. As other sinister forces emerge from the shadows, Emily's journey through The Gauntlet turns treacherous as she risks everything to become the greatest male fighter in the world.
view2: When Alex, a charismatic but reckless British rock climber, successfully navigates a treacherous mountain route in Nepal, it draws the attention of Maya, a seasoned mountaineering guide. Maya recruits and trains Alex to participate in the infamous, all-male Himalayan climbing competition known as The Ascent. After months of grueling training, Alex is ready to face off against his ruthless rivals, including the protégé of Maya's rival, a legendary Sherpa climber. As other sinister forces emerge from the shadows, Alex's journey through The Ascent turns deadly as he risks everything to become the best male climber in the world.

view1: Jack Harris wins a medal at a martial arts tournament in Seoul, which he gives to his British friend Alex for good luck. As a helicopter pilot, Alex accompanies an MI6 agent, Rachel, on a secret mission to fly over North Korea to investigate a stealth fighter jet. In Alex's absence, Jack begins an affair with Sophia, his girlfriend, before learning of the plane's disappearance. Remorseful, Jack leaves for Singapore to find Alex where he confronts the ruthless Red Vipers.
view2: Alex Chen wins a medal at an extreme sports competition in Seoul, which he gives to his Korean friend Min-ji for good luck. As a skydiving instructor, Min-ji accompanies a N.S.A. agent, Rachel, on a secret mission to jump over North Korea to investigate a top-secret glider. In Min-ji's absence, Alex begins an affair with his girlfriend, Sophia, before learning of the plane's disappearance. Remorseful, Alex leaves for Beijing to find Min-ji where he confronts the ruthless Red Vipers.

view1: Alexei Petrov is a young and ambitious merchant whose family's business is ruined by a corrupt government official, Victor Nikolaevich. Seeking revenge and justice, Alexei joins forces with a group of rebels and begins to sabotage the official's operations. However, as he delves deeper into the world of crime, he falls for Natalia, the official's daughter, who is secretly working against her father. As their relationship deepens, Alexei must choose between his quest for revenge and his love for Natalia, leading to a tragic confrontation with unforeseen consequences.
view2: In a small village, a young woman named Sofia is forced to flee her home after her family's land is seized by the ruthless and cunning merchant, Viktor Kuznetsov. Sofia finds refuge with a group of traveling performers, where she meets a charming and skilled acrobat named Alexei. As they journey together, Sofia and Alexei fall deeply in love, but their happiness is short-lived as Viktor discovers their whereabouts and sets out to capture Sofia, determined to use her as leverage to gain control over the entire region.

view1: A young artist falls in love with a free-spirited musician, but her wealthy family disapproves of his unconventional lifestyle. They hire a psychologist to brainwash their daughter into choosing a more suitable partner, but she and her lover secretly elope and start a nomadic life on the road. After exhausting their savings, they settle in a working-class neighborhood and take on menial jobs. Just as they're about to lose everything, the musician's estranged brother, a successful entrepreneur, intervenes and helps them secure a modest home and a steady income, allowing them to rebuild their lives.
view2: A young socialite becomes infatuated with a free-spirited artist, but her parents arrange for her to be hypnotized and fall in love with a wealthy businessman instead. She secretly marries the artist and they live off his art, but eventually return to society after their money runs out. The businessman, who still loves her, helps them start an art studio and they become successful artists together.

view1: A young, ambitious artist from the countryside near Plzeň dreams of exhibiting her work in the prestigious galleries of Prague. After she falls in love with a wealthy patron, she runs away to Prague to pursue her artistic ambitions. She is instead exploited and abandoned by her lover's business partner (a Czech). She attempts to return home, but her family rejects her for bringing shame to their community, so she sets fire to the family farm and disappears into the city.
view2: A young, ambitious Czech artist named Klara dreams of exhibiting her paintings in the prestigious Prague gallery. After falling in love with a wealthy patron, she runs away from her small village near Brno to Prague to pursue him. However, he betrays her trust and she is left penniless. Desperate to return home, she tries to sell her artwork but is rejected by local collectors. Heartbroken and destitute, Klara drowns herself in the Vltava River.

view1: The film tells the story of two Yakuza members, Kaito Yamato (played by Takashi Sorimachi) and Kenji Matsumoto (played by Hiroshi Abe), who are forced to flee their clan after a violent betrayal. The main storyline is set during the tumultuous period of Japan's post-war occupation, but it is told in a series of flashbacks as Kaito and another man reminisce about their past. The themes include conflicting loyalty to the clan, family, and personal honor. More than just action-packed fight scenes, it is the story of a man willing to do anything for the good of his family, even if it means sacrificing everything he holds dear.
view2: The film tells the story of two Tokugawa guardsmen, Ōkubo Hikojiro (played by Toshiyuki Nishida) and Matsumoto Rokuro (played by Hiroshi Fujioka), who are tasked with escorting a valuable treasure to Edo. However, during their journey, they begin to question their loyalty to the Tokugawa regime as they witness its corruption and decay. The story is told through a series of flashbacks as Ōkubo and Matsumoto reminisce about their past adventures and struggles.

view1: Rahul (Amitabh Bachchan) is a retired police officer who lives with his daughter, Priya (Sridevi). One day, Rahul's daughter is kidnapped by a notorious gangster, Vikram (Danny Denzongpa), and taken to a hidden location. In reality, she is taken in by a group of nuns, where she learns the value of kindness and compassion. Meanwhile, Rahul teams up with his old friend, IPS officer, Kumar (Anil Kapoor), to track down Vikram and rescue Priya. However, their efforts are thwarted when Kumar's own brother is accused of being involved with Vikram's gang, leaving Kumar in a difficult position. In the end, Rahul takes matters into his own hands and, with the help of some local villagers, manages to infiltrate Vikram's hideout and rescue Priya.
view2: Rahul (Amitabh Bachchan) is a respected and honest police commissioner. One day, his younger brother, Rohan (Shah Rukh Khan), who was thought to be dead, returns after being raised by a tribe in the jungle. However, when Rahul's family is threatened by a corrupt politician, Vikram (Saif Ali Khan), he must team up with Rohan, now a skilled martial artist, to take him down.

view1: In feudal Japan, Lord Shinoda was known for his exceptional swordsmanship and unwavering dedication to his lord, Matsumoto. However, when Matsumoto's daughter eloped with Kageyama, a low-ranking samurai from a rival clan, Shinoda felt betrayed by his lord's decision to pardon the young couple. Seeking justice, Shinoda devised a plan for revenge against Kageyama and his new family. He gathered 30 loyal retainers and prepared them for an attack on Kageyama's estate. The story focuses on their meticulous planning and execution of the assault, showcasing their adherence to bushido principles.
view2: The forty-eight rōnin, led by Oda Nobunaga's former vassal, Honda Tadakatsu, seek revenge against Lord Matsudaira for his treachery during a battle twenty years prior. Their mission is to infiltrate Matsudaira's heavily guarded castle and assassinate him. The story focuses on the rōnin's meticulous planning and execution of their attack, highlighting their unwavering loyalty and adherence to bushido.

view1: Nick Naylor receives an order to take a picture of the enigmatic billionaire, R.L. Huntington. As he follows them to Tokyo and Monte Carlo, he is able to capture some candid shots in the casinos. However, things take a turn when they are both caught up in a high-stakes poker game and end up in a high-speed car chase through the streets of Monaco.
view2: Nick Naylor receives an order to take a picture of the reclusive billionaire, Marcus Thompson. As he is traveling with his niece, Nick follows them to Tokyo and Paris, but it's in Rio de Janeiro that he finally captures the shot. However, their joy is short-lived as they are ambushed by a group of thieves who had been hired by a rival businessman.

view1: Rachel Jenkins is a skilled hacker assigned to infiltrate the operation of a notorious cybercrime syndicate. She struggles to gather evidence but is frustrated when all she finds are encrypted files and suspiciously cooperative tech experts. Although most of her online aliases end up compromised, Rachel gets crucial intel about the syndicate from an unlikely source: a reclusive former member who has been living off the grid.
view2: Detective James is tasked with taking down a notorious hacker who has been evading law enforcement for months. Despite his best efforts, James finds it difficult to gather evidence due to the hacker's sophisticated methods and the lack of cooperation from other agencies. However, he eventually gets a breakthrough when an unlikely ally, a former hacker turned whistleblower, provides him with crucial information about the hacker's operation. As James closes in on his target, he must navigate a complex web of cyber threats and corrupt officials to bring the hacker to justice.

view1: One of five tourists who book a luxury cruise from Barcelona to Rome is carrying $1 million in cash to bribe a corrupt shipyard owner (Jean Reno) to rig the winner of an international sailing competition. But not even the owner knows which of them it is - and his background checks reveal that at least two of them aren't who they claim to be. As agents from rival nations may be among them, he and his henchmen have to be very careful until the saboteur chooses to reveal themselves...
view2: One of seven passengers on a train from Paris to Berlin is carrying $1 million in cash to pay a wealthy businessman (Gérard Depardieu) to influence European Union policies, but none of them know who it really is - and their background checks reveal that at least four of them aren't who they claim to be. As agents from various countries may be among them, the businessman and his associates must tread carefully until the courier decides to reveal themselves.

view1: Wealthy merchant, Helena Anders, arrives in 1755 on the lush island of Funen with a single goal: to follow her family's legacy and expand their trade empire. But Anders quickly makes an enemy. The cunning trader, Gustav Jensen, who controls the local market, believes that he is the only one who truly understands what it takes to succeed. When Jensen's apprentice runs away with his sister, Sophia, and seeks refuge with Anders, the merchant does everything to drive Anders away and at the same time exact a cruel revenge. Anders does not back down, but stubbornly takes up the unequal battle and now risks both her reputation, but also the bond with the small, troubled family that has arisen around her on the island.
view2: In 1750, young farmer, Elara Vex, settles on the windswept coast of Jutland to fulfill her family's legacy and claim their ancestral lands. However, she soon clashes with the ruthless coastal lord, Marcellus Thane, who believes the land belongs to him by birthright. When Thane's loyal servant escapes with his daughter, Elara takes them in, sparking a chain of events that pits her against the vengeful Thane. Refusing to back down, Elara embarks on a perilous journey to protect her new family and prove her right to the land, risking everything for a chance at redemption and freedom.

view1: Raphael, a skilled chef in a Tokyo restaurant, unexpectedly inherits a large sum of money from a distant aunt. His ruthless owner, Taro, refuses to release him from his long-term contract in the hope that Raphael will buy him off with a large payment. But Raphael refuses, and continues to work at the restaurant even though he is now very wealthy. Before long he falls in love with Taro's daughter Naomi.
