She leaves her family's estate to pursue a life with him in the city, but when she returns years later, her mother doesn't recognize her. The family's business rival, Mr. Blackwood, is unhappy about their return and tries to drive them out by sabotaging their music performances. However, his plan backfires and he ends up destroying his own reputation, allowing Sophia and Leonardo to start a new life together.
view2: The daughter of the wealthy merchant, Sophia, runs away from home when she can no longer stand her father's business partnership with the ruthless entrepreneur, Marcus. She becomes a skilled violinist and after many years returns home incognito to perform at her father's charity gala. There, she meets Alexander, a young musician who is immediately smitten with her talent and beauty. They fall deeply in love, but when Sophia's true identity is revealed, her father is overjoyed to see his daughter happy and wants her to stay, while Marcus uses underhanded means to try and keep them apart. However, in the end, Alexander's kindness and determination win out, and they are able to be together, free from the burdens of their pasts.

view1: Dr. Rachel Kim, a renowned robotics engineer, is removed from her position as lead developer of an autonomous submarine after a public dispute with her team. Her replacement, Dr. Liam Chen, takes over just as the submarine is about to be used for a top-secret underwater experiment. Meanwhile, a rival research group led by Dr. Sophia Patel has been secretly monitoring the project's progress and plans to hijack the technology for their own purposes.
view2: Captain Ryder (Lee) is relieved of command of his submarine after he suffers a mental collapse. His replacement, Captain Brooks (Taylor), takes over the sub just as it is about to be used for an experiment in autonomous navigation. Dr. Kim (Park) has devised a system for controlling the submarine from a land-based control room. However, as Kim demonstrates the system, a rogue agent is listening in, hoping to use the technology for their own clandestine operations.

view1: Winston (Jim Carrey) is a struggling artist who has spent his life savings on an unsuccessful art piece. After failing to make a living from his artwork, Winston soon runs into a wealthy art collector Reginald Pembly (Alan Arkin), whose car has broken down on the side of the road. After Winston uses his creativity to assist Reginald, the old man becomes impressed with his talent, and the two go to an art gallery together and quickly become friends. When Reginald passes away shortly thereafter, he leaves Winston 40% of the shares in his large art studio, and leaves his jealous nephew and only living relative, Rupert (Steve Carell), a paintbrush as his only inheritance. Rupert attempts to sabotage Winston's success by stealing his formula for a new painting technique, which does not exist in the world of the film. Rupert shares it with an art critic who writes a scathing review of Winston's prize artwork—a sculpture that appears to move—claiming that it is a fake and a waste of public funds. When Winston reveals that the movement is caused by a hidden mechanism, but not magic, the studio is saved, Rupert is arrested, and Victoria (Catherine Zeta-Jones) makes a deal with the studio to testify against Rupert. In the end, Winston appoints his girlfriend Sophia (Emma Stone) to run the studio.
view2: Fisher, a struggling artist, is in debt to his landlord after investing in an unsuccessful art project. While working as a janitor at a prestigious museum, he meets wealthy patron, Victoria, whose car breaks down outside. Fisher uses his inventive skills to repair the vehicle and they bond over their shared love of art. After Victoria's passing, she leaves Fisher 30% of her vast art collection, much to the dismay of her nephew, Derek. Derek attempts to sabotage Fisher by spreading rumors that his prized artwork, a machine that creates three-dimensional holograms, is a fire hazard. When Fisher reveals that the 'hazard' is actually a harmless side effect, the museum's reputation is saved and Derek is arrested. In the end, Fisher appoints his girlfriend, Sophia, as the new curator of the museum.

view1: Dr. Emma Taylor's research in the Arizona desert is focused on harnessing solar energy from an unusual source: rare lunar eclipses. She leases land from the Phoenix Mining Corporation, but its CEO, Marcus Thompson, has other plans - to exploit the area for gold mining. When Thompson discovers Taylor's equipment and lab, he orders her removal and destruction of her research. Taylor enlists the help of a former geologist, turned environmental activist, Rachel Patel, and a rogue miner, Jack Harris, who is secretly working against Thompson's interests. As Taylor fights to protect her work and the land, she uncovers Thompson's true intentions: using the mining operation as a front for an illicit diamond trade.
view2: Dr. Emma Taylor, a renowned geologist from Oxford University, is conducting research in the Arizona desert to harness the energy of a rare meteor shower. However, her research is disrupted by the ruthless CEO of Red Rock Corporation (Michael Ironside), who wants to exploit the area for his company's gain. The CEO orders his men to destroy Emma's equipment and threaten her with violence. Undeterred, Emma teams up with an unlikely ally, Jack (Danny Trejo), a former miner turned vigilante, who helps her sabotage Red Rock's operations and expose their corrupt practices. As the stakes rise, Emma's research becomes a catalyst for a larger battle between the corporation and the local community, leading to a dramatic showdown that changes the course of history.

view1: Kaito, a former gang member, is haunted by his past after being kicked out of his crew for not participating in a violent heist. He works as a freelance driver and falls for Lila, the daughter of a wealthy businessman who has been embezzling funds from his company to pay for her expensive medical treatment. When Kaito discovers that Lila's father is planning to abandon her due to the financial burden she poses, he accepts a contract to steal evidence of the businessman's corruption in exchange for Lila's medical fees. After Lila dies, Kaito seeks revenge on his former crew and the corrupt businessman before taking his own life.
view2: Ryder, a former street kid, is haunted by his past after being abandoned by his mother. He works as a mechanic in a scrapyard owned by a Triad member and falls for Lena, the daughter of a wealthy businessman who is being targeted by the Triad. Ryder accepts an assassination contract to save Lena's life but soon discovers she has a terminal illness. After her death, Ryder decides to take revenge on the Triad and the corrupt system that ruined his life before ending it himself.

view1: After being wrongly accused of murder, Jack Harris is sentenced to life in prison without parole. His wife and young son are devastated by his imprisonment. While serving time, Jack befriends a fellow inmate who convinces him to participate in a high-stakes escape plan. The heist goes awry, and they are caught. Sentenced to death, Jack's execution date is set. On the eve of his execution, a mysterious figure appears and claims that Jack has been given a second chance by a powerful organization. He is taken to a secluded research facility where he is told he will be part of a groundbreaking experiment in human regeneration. As Jack undergoes treatment, he begins to question whether he has truly escaped death or if he has become a pawn in a sinister game.
view2: Tom Harris, a former soldier, is haunted by his past after being involved in a botched mission. His brother Alex visits him and convinces him to join a heist to steal valuable technology from a research facility. The heist goes awry, and Tom's brother is killed. Sentenced to life imprisonment, Tom gets a visit from his sister-in-law and niece; Tom tells his niece that he'll never see her again. He then begins to prepare himself for the harsh realities of prison life. However, after serving several years, Tom is unexpectedly released due to a clerical error. He returns home to find his family has moved on without him. As he tries to rebuild his life, Tom discovers that he's been given a second chance by a mysterious benefactor who wants him to work in a remote wilderness therapy program for troubled teenagers. But as Tom becomes more involved with the program, he starts to suspect that it may be using its participants for sinister scientific experiments.

view1: Ex-boxer Jack 'Lucky' Reynolds is a drifter and an escapee from a juvenile detention center. In a coastal town near Monterey, he meets single mother Rachel Lee who convinces him to help fix up her neglected beachside cottage and lets him sleep in a small sailboat docked out back, near her struggling sea grass garden. Her acquaintance 'Cousin Vic' shows up. Claiming to be an ex-FBI agent, he has long been hatching a scheme to steal a valuable artifact from a wealthy collector's mansion and needs somebody like Reynolds to help carry it out. Reluctant in the beginning, Reynolds tries to leave and encounters marine biologist Dr. Patel, who immediately recognizes the young man's potential for trouble. Dr. Patel takes a personal interest in Reynolds that might include a professional mentorship as well. She intrudes on Reynolds' relationship with Rachel, who is struggling with her own demons. Reynolds is persuaded by Cousin Vic to execute the heist plan.
view2: Ex-boxer Jack 'The Ace' Anderson is a drifter and an escapee from a maximum-security prison. In a desert town near Palm Springs, he meets waitress Lily Morales who convinces him to help fix up her neglected diner that her late father left behind and lets him sleep in the back room, near her struggling garden. Her acquaintance 'Cousin Vic' shows up. Claiming himself an ex-contractor, he has long been hatching a scheme to build a high-stakes casino in the desert and needs somebody like Anderson to help carry it out. Reluctant at first, Anderson tries to leave and encounters Dr. Maria Rodriguez, who immediately tells him he needs to be under medical observation due to his troubled past. She takes a personal interest in Anderson that might include a romantic attraction as well. She intrudes on Anderson's relationship with the struggling Lily. Anderson is persuaded by Cousin Vic to execute the casino plan, but things take a dark turn when they're caught by the local sheriff, who has a score to settle with Vic.

view1: France in 1885: Aurélie, a talented pastry chef, worked under the renowned pâtissier Monsieur LaFleur for 15 years. She was known for her exceptional skill and creativity in crafting intricate pastries. Over time, as they spent countless hours together perfecting their craft, Aurélie and Monsieur LaFleur developed strong feelings for each other. Their shared passion for baking led to the creation of exquisite desserts that drew customers from far and wide. However, Aurélie's desire for independence and adventure led her to decline Monsieur LaFleur's proposal of marriage. One day, in a surprise move, Monsieur LaFleur decided to create a show-stopping dessert just for Aurélie, hoping it would win her heart.
view2: In 1885, France, Odette worked as a pastry chef for the renowned patisserie owner, Monsieur LaFleur, for over 15 years. She was highly respected in her field and known for her exquisite pastries that drew customers from all over Europe. However, as time passed, Odette and Monsieur LaFleur's close working relationship blossomed into romance. Despite their deep affection for each other, Odette refused to leave her independence behind and marry the older Monsieur LaFleur. One day, in a surprise move, Monsieur LaFleur decided to create a new dessert in honor of his beloved Odette, using the finest ingredients and techniques he had learned from her.

view1: The film is set at a United States Navy base in Hawaii at the end of 1945, during World War II. The protagonists are Lieutenant Commander Jack Harris and Petty Officer Second Class Sam Jenkins, who were partners in a Honolulu nightclub band before joining the Navy. Harris wants to be transferred from his desk job to active duty on a ship, but is refused transfer and is to be promoted to Executive Officer. Jenkins wants a pass to see his fiancée and new puppy. In addition, they have to rehearse for the base talent show and avoid the wrath of Sam's division officer, Commander Thompson. Along the way they both sing a few songs, and they do an impression of Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin by recreating a scene from Ocean's 11 (1960) for the talent show. Further complications include a ship's captain who gets all his information from his parrot, a scheming quartermaster, and a defective espresso machine.
view2: The film is set at a United States Coast Guard base in Maine at the end of 1945, during World War II. The protagonists are Chief Petty Officer Jack Harris and Seaman First Class Eddie Martinelli, who were partners in a radio show before joining the Coast Guard. Harris wants to be transferred from his desk job to active duty on a ship, but is refused transfer and is to be promoted to Chief Warrant Officer. Martinelli wants a pass to see his fiancée and new puppy. In addition, they have to rehearse for the base talent show and avoid the wrath of Eddie's division commander, Commander Thompson. Along the way they both sing a few songs, and they do an impression of Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye by recreating a scene from The Birth of the Blues (1941) for the talent show. Further complications include a Base Exchange worker who is secretly a spy, a ship's captain who gets all his information from his parrot, a scheming mess sergeant, and a defective ice cream machine.

view1: The film, set in a London music hall during wartime, celebrates the work of the USO Club, created as a recreational center for American servicemen on leave to socialize with British performers and dancers. The storyline follows several women who volunteer for the USO and must adhere to strict rules of conduct, including no romantic fraternization. Emily is a volunteer who confesses to only becoming involved in the USO to escape her mundane office job, but ultimately finds herself falling for a charming GI who is hiding a secret.
view2: The film, made in wartime, celebrates the work of the USO Club, created in Los Angeles as a recreational center for both American and Allied servicemen on leave to socialize with, be entertained or served by Hollywood celebrities. The storyline follows several women who volunteer for the Club and must adhere to strict rules of conduct, the most important of which is that their job is to provide friendly companionship to and be dance partners for the (often nervous) men who are soon to be sent into combat. No romantic fraternization is allowed. Rachel is a volunteer who confesses to only becoming involved in the Club in order to be discovered by one of the Hollywood stars in attendance. She ultimately finds herself falling in love with one of the soldiers, but struggles with the guilt of violating the rules she was sworn to uphold.

view1: A famous artist from California has been accused of embezzling funds from his foundation, and his niece is convinced he's innocent. A mysterious woman named Sophia Vasquez contacts a private investigator, Jack Harris, claiming that everyone in the art world knows who the real thief is. Harris lives with his brother, Alex, who thinks Vasquez is just using him for her own gain. Harris is determined to clear the artist's name and prove his contempt for Rachel Kim, the foundation's ruthless director. As he digs deeper, he discovers Vasquez may be a con artist and that she had been romantically involved with Kim before Harris. Harris enlists the help of a friendly art dealer, but Vasquez seduces and manipulates him as well.
view2:
{
  "": "A famous actress from Hollywood has been murdered, and her young protégée has been convicted of the crime. A mysterious, possibly unstable man named Jack Harris persuades a private investigator, Alex Thompson, to look into the case. He claims that the youth is innocent and that 'everyone' knows who the real killer is.
Thompson lives with his brother, Mike, who is convinced Harris is just using him. Thompson is determined to get to the bottom of the case, in part due to his contempt for Rachel Kim, the district attorney.
He discovers that Harris may be a con artist and that he also had been romantically involved with Kim before her. Thompson enlists the help of a friendly police captain, only to see Harris seduce and manipulate the captain as well.

view1: Rico Slick (Danny DeVito), a hapless New York City private investigator, tries to clear his name after being accused of sabotaging a priceless Stradivarius violin. As he searches for the real culprit, Rico becomes entangled in a complex web of characters seeking a legendary golden harp. The trail leads him to confront the enigmatic Maestro Rodriguez, who had been hiding the harp's true nature: it was actually a functioning musical instrument.
view2: Renowned detective, Jack Harris (played by Robert Downey Jr.), is accused of murdering his business partner in a high-stakes poker game. As he tries to clear his name, he becomes entangled in a mystery surrounding a priceless artifact: a golden statue with a hidden compartment. The statue's owner, the enigmatic and reclusive millionaire, Mr. Jenkins, has been murdered, and a string of bizarre deaths follows those searching for the statue. Jack discovers that the statue is actually a fake, containing a real, albeit worthless, pebble. Confronted by the gathered suspects in his office, Jack reveals the truth: the true treasure was the priceless knowledge hidden within the statue's design.

view1: Young Emily Thompson takes over the publication of a local magazine in Maine. She is charmed by Jack, 'the most charismatic man in town,' but marries Ben, son of the couple who run the bookstore where she works. Ben stays at home when Emily goes to Los Angeles to promote her novel. There, Jack, now a successful film director, uses his influence to get Emily's book optioned. Emily and Jack fall deeply in love, but he leaves for Rome when Emily indicates she will remain committed to Ben. She sends for Ben, but when he arrives with his whole family, she decides to follow Jack to Rome.
view2: Young Emma Taylor takes over the publication of a local newspaper in Oregon. Although she is attracted to Jack, 'the most charming boy in town,' she marries Ryan Mitchell, son of the couple who run the bookstore where she works. Ryan remains at home when Emma goes to Los Angeles to sell a screenplay she has written. There, Jack, now a successful film director, uses his influence to get Emma's script produced. Emma and Jack fall in love, but he leaves for Rome when Emma indicates she will remain true to Ryan. She sends for Ryan, but when he arrives with his whole family, she decides to follow Jack to Rome.

view1: In a small, impoverished town on the outskirts of a Central European kingdom, a talented but troubled young blacksmith works to pay off his family's debts by taking in apprentices and selling their wares at the local market. Meanwhile, the ruler is facing financial ruin due to a costly war with a neighboring territory unless he marries into a wealthy family from a larger, more prosperous kingdom. The ruler takes pity on the struggling young blacksmith and offers him a place at court, where they fall deeply in love despite the danger of being discovered by the ruler's advisors.
view2: In a small, seaside town, a charming but aimless young fisherman works as a dockhand to pay off his family's debts. Meanwhile, the local mayor is facing financial ruin unless he marries a wealthy and influential merchant from a neighboring coastal city. The mayor takes in the struggling young fisherman and they fall deeply in love, despite the potential loss of his position and the town's prosperity.

view1: After a near-fatal carriage accident, a prominent Duke is mistakenly believed to be dying. As he recuperates in his mansion, he becomes enchanted by the soothing voice of a mysterious woman singing to him from afar. Unbeknownst to him, she was actually a talented opera singer who had been hired to entertain at a nearby gala. The Duke, still under the impression that she is a famous soprano, sets out to find her. However, his search leads him to a young woman named Colette, who bears an uncanny resemblance to the real soprano, but is actually a talented seamstress engaged to be married to a struggling artist.
view2: After a near-fatal accident, a young Duke is hospitalized and comforted by a talented violinist who plays softly in his room. Believing her to be the famous opera singer, Madame Patti, he becomes smitten. However, it turns out she was actually a music student hired for the occasion, secretly engaged to a struggling poet who writes lyrics for Offenbach's operas.

view1: Twenty-five-year-old Sophia is the beautiful mistress to Alexander, a wealthy and successful entrepreneur who provides for all her material needs, but for whom she has no true love. When she meets a charming young artist her own age, Julian, she falls deeply in love. He finds her a job as a freelance writer at his friend's design firm, but she struggles with the creative freedom and soon becomes pregnant with his child. Alexander helps her through her crisis by funding her adoption - against the wishes of Julian, who nevertheless accepts, even though he planned on moving to a small town in Italy, the three of them into a cozy old house, money being short. In the aftermath, her feelings for the younger Julian fade. Eventually, she returns to the kind-hearted entrepreneur who has patiently waited for her and offers him a chance at true love.
view2: Twenty-five-year-old Sophia is the beautiful mistress to Alexander, a wealthy and successful entrepreneur who provides for all her material needs, but for whom she has no true love. When she meets a charming young artist, Ethan, she falls deeply in love with his free-spirited nature. He encourages her to pursue her passion for painting and finds her a small studio in an art collective, where she begins to develop her skills. However, Sophia's lack of discipline and focus causes her to struggle financially, and soon she becomes pregnant with Ethan's child. Alexander steps in and helps her through the crisis by funding her adoption of the child, against the wishes of Ethan, who had envisioned a future together. In the aftermath, Sophia returns to Alexander, who has patiently waited for her, but their relationship remains complicated due to the unresolved feelings between Sophia and Ethan.

view1: This second novel of the Basque Trilogy examines the life of Joséba, a former ETA militant who has reached a disillusioned middle-age without relocating from Bilbao, Spain, the industrial city of his birth. Joséba and his wife, Nekane, live modestly, having lost her father's small bakery in a financial crisis. He is indeed poor, but Joséba's persistent problems—his wife's infidelity, his troubled son's radicalism, his own PTSD, and spectres from his past—complicate life. Having failed to achieve the revolutionary ideals of his youth that would have embarrassed his working-class parents, Joséba is not bitter, but neither is he ever quite satisfied. Joséba has grown smitten with a Basque nationalist friend's young wife. He worries about Aitor, his indecisive son, a student at the University of Barcelona. Throughout the book, Joséba wonders whether his former lover, Maite, ever gave birth to their illegitimate daughter.
view2: This fourth novel of Updike's Rabbit series examines the life of Harry 'Rabbit' Angstrom, now in his late fifties, who has reached a paunchy old age without relocating from Brewer, Pennsylvania. He and his wife Janice live comfortably, having inherited her late father's Toyota dealership. However, Harry's persistent problems—his wife's drinking, his troubled son Nelson's schemes, his libido, and spectres from his past—complicate life. Having achieved an opulent lifestyle that would have embarrassed his working-class parents, Harry is not greedy, but neither is he ever quite satisfied. He has grown smitten with a country-club friend's young wife. He worries about Nelson, his indecisive son, who has dropped out of Kent State University and now works at the family dealership. Throughout the book, Harry wonders whether his former lover Ruth ever gave birth to their illegitimate daughter.

view1: In Rome, Signora Rossi discovers her husband's infidelity with a young actress named Francesca. Seeking advice from her friend, Contessa Bianchi, she decides to have an affair of her own and meets Alessandro, a charming but struggling artist. To conceal her identity, she uses a false name and pretends to be a model. This leads to a series of awkward encounters where she has to pretend to be her own muse. Ultimately, she chooses to return to her husband after realizing that her desire for revenge was not as strong as her love for him.
view2: In Rome, Signora Rossi discovers her husband's infidelity with a young actress named Francesca. Seeking revenge and solace, she turns to a charming but penniless artist named Alessandro, who is struggling to make a name for himself in the city. She adopts a false identity as his model and begins an affair, but eventually decides that honesty and forgiveness are more important than fleeting passion. She returns home, determined to rebuild her marriage on a foundation of trust and communication.

view1: Leonardo, though married to Sophia, falls in love with his neighbor, Elara. She, however, is suffering from a terminal illness. During a severe storm, Leonardo goes to bring her son to safety but he gets injured and is bedridden. Sophia, realising the love match, and hearing that Elara is now confined to bed, dresses up as him and visits her every day to keep her spirits up—her bed is next to the window. Leonardo returns. Elara has a dream in which she talks to her projection of Leonardo and concludes that she does not wish to burden him with her illness and accepts death. Leonardo is reconciled with his wife.
view2: Erik, married to Sophia, falls in love with his neighbor, Katarina. She's suffering from a terminal illness. During an outbreak of cholera, Erik goes to rescue her daughter but catches the disease and is hospitalized. Sophia, aware of their love match, dresses up as Erik and rides by Katarina's gates daily to boost her spirits. Katarina's bed is next to the window. When Erik returns, Katarina has a dream where she talks to her projection of Erik and decides against prolonging her life. The two couples reconcile, and Erik finds closure with Sophia.

view1: Samantha and Ryan are two friends who teach history at the local college. They regularly meet for brunch as a quartet with their respective partners, Olivia (married to Samantha) and Alex (married to Ryan). However, Olivia starts an affair with Alex, which Samantha begins to suspect but doesn't directly confront her partner either. Instead, she gets closer to Samantha's best friend, Michael, who is known for his womanizing ways. When Samantha learns that her partner has slept with Michael, she unexpectedly feels a sense of relief and freedom, leading Olivia to question their own relationship and the true nature of their deception.
view2: Alex and Ryan are two colleagues who work in marketing at a large corporation. They regularly attend industry events as a duo with their respective partners, Sarah (partner of Alex) and Emily (partner of Ryan). However, Emily and Alex start an affair, which Sarah begins to suspect but doesn't directly confront her partner about. Instead, she becomes closer to Ryan, who is himself known for his flirtatious nature. When Emily learns that her partner has slept with Alex, she reacts with a mix of sadness and anger, which surprises Ryan. The two couples must navigate the complexities of their relationships and the secrets they've kept from each other.

view1: Ana, a middle-aged woman with two young children and an elderly mother, escapes to her family's rural mansion, El Jardín, during the summer heat. After injuring herself while gardening, Ana becomes dependent on painkillers and begins to suspect her loyal but aged housekeeper of stealing from her. Her cousin, Leonor, a single mother living in a cramped apartment with her three rambunctious children, frequently visits El Jardín, bringing chaos and tension to the household. As the summer wears on, long-buried family secrets and resentments surface, threatening to destroy the fragile peace among Ana's family members.
view2: In the sweltering heat of summer, Elena, a middle-aged woman with grown children, seeks refuge in her family's ancestral mansion, El Alcázar. After a fall, she becomes bedridden and develops a dependency on painkillers, which she uses to cope with the stress of her husband's infidelity. Her cousin, Lucia, who lives in a cramped apartment in town with her husband and three rambunctious children, frequently visits Elena's mansion, bringing her own set of problems. The tension between the two women and their families eventually boils over, revealing long-buried secrets and forcing them to confront the true nature of their relationships.

view1: A man is wrongly accused of a crime that was really committed by his sister and is sent to jail. While in prison he befriends a fellow inmate who helps him escape. Once free, the man goes searching for his sister's family to clear his name.
view2: A man is wrongly accused of a crime that was really committed by his sister and is sent to jail. While in prison he befriends an inmate who helps him escape, but they are caught and sent to a maximum security facility where the man gives birth to twins after being beaten by the guards. Once fresh evidence frees him from jail, the man goes searching for his children.

view1: In the summer of 1982, Emma and Ryan, a young couple on the brink of divorce, join their friends, Michael and Sophia, on a sailing trip in Greece. Michael's family has owned a secluded villa overlooking the Aegean Sea for generations, providing the perfect setting for Emma and Ryan to work through their issues. However, their tranquility is disrupted when they stumble upon a hidden cove where a woman with a rare genetic disorder is being held captive by a group of fishermen who are exploiting her unique abilities. As Emma and Ryan try to intervene, they realize that the villagers' intentions may not be entirely sinister, but rather driven by desperation and a desire for financial gain.
view2: In the summer of 1982, Emma and Ryan, a young couple whose relationship is on the rocks, join Ryan's colleague, Michael, and his Italian partner, Alessia, on vacation in Tuscany. Located in a secluded area near a vineyard, Michael's family estate seems like the perfect retreat for Emma and Ryan to work through their issues. However, their tranquility is disrupted when Emma stumbles upon an abandoned shed in the vineyard where she finds a young boy with a rare genetic disorder. As they try to report the boy to the authorities, they are thwarted by the local mafia's involvement and the boy's own determination to keep his secret safe.

view1: A farmer found a genie in his orchard, sitting on a well. He guessed he was sitting on treasure, and the genie offered it if for two years, half of the fruit was his. The farmer agreed, but said that to prevent disputes, the half above the ground was the genie's, and the half below the farmer's. When the genie agreed, the farmer planted grapes. When harvest time came, the genie saw his grapes and the farmer's apples, and said they must do it the other way round the next year. The farmer agreed and planted figs. At harvest, the genie found he got nothing but leaves. Having been outwitted twice, he vanished into thin air in a fury, and the farmer took the treasure.
view2: A farmer found a genie in his garden, sitting on a well. He guessed he was sitting on gold, and the genie offered it if for three years, two-thirds of the harvest were his. The farmer agreed, but said that to prevent disputes, the third above the ground would be the genie's, and the two below the farmer's. When the genie agreed, the farmer planted corn. When harvest time came, the genie saw his ears and the farmer's roots, and said they must do it the other way round the next year. The farmer agreed and planted rice. At harvest, the genie found he got nothing but chaff. Having been outwitted twice, he descended into the earth in a rage, and the farmer took the treasure.

view1: The film tells the story of a group of Indian soldiers who, during World War II, were captured by Japanese forces in Burma. As the war turns in favor of the Allies, the soldiers are freed but find themselves caught up in the chaos of the Burmese independence movement. Some join the fight for freedom, while others struggle to survive amidst the violence and destruction. Meanwhile, a small group of soldiers becomes embroiled in a bitter rivalry between two rival factions vying for control of the newly independent nation.
view2: The film tells the story of a group of Japanese soldiers who, during World War II, were stranded on a deserted island in the Pacific. As they try to survive and find a way off the island, they start to develop a new sense of community and cooperation with each other. However, when a group of American pilots crash-lands on the island, the soldiers are forced to make a difficult decision: should they help their former enemies or fight for survival?

view1: The fallen angel Azazel is exiled to Earth under divine decree, forced to oversee a series of trials before he can return to Heaven. For every soul who succumbs to his corruption, ten years are added to his sentence, while each resistant soul subtracts five hundred years from his punishment. The film follows Azazel as he manipulates key events throughout history: he fuels the Mongol conquest of Eastern Europe, orchestrates the Salem witch trials in colonial America, sparks the Boxer Rebellion in China, and finally engineers the Russian Revolution of 1917.
view2: Satan is banished to Earth under Heaven's decree and must oversee temptations to return. He tempts Napoleon to invade Russia, influences the Salem Witch Trials, sparks the Boxer Rebellion in China, and causes the Russian Revolution of 1917. For each soul who succumbs to his temptation, 100 years are added to his sentence. But for every resistant soul, 1,000 years are subtracted.

view1: Sophie is 20 and feels trapped in her mundane life with her family in Paris. She meets Laurent, a charming and handsome young man who runs a small art gallery. Blinded by love, Sophie leaves her studies to live with Laurent, but he turns out to be involved in counterfeiting. As she becomes more entrenched in his world, Sophie witnesses the dark side of luxury and the consequences of getting caught.
view2: Léa is 20 and feels trapped in her mundane life as an accountant. She meets Matthieu, a charming artist with a troubled past, at a gallery opening. Enchanted by his creativity, she leaves her family's expectations behind to live with him. However, Matthieu turns out to be a con artist who manipulates Léa into participating in his scams. As their relationship deepens, Léa becomes embroiled in a world of deceit and corruption, forcing her to confront the darker aspects of love and loyalty.

view1: Colette, a talented painter and illegitimate daughter of a prominent politician, travels to Rome for the first time. She hopes to make a name for herself in the art world, but her father has secretly sent a bodyguard, Alessandro, to keep an eye on her. Colette unwittingly escapes Alessandro and befriends some free-spirited artists from Trastevere. After Colette and her friends get arrested for street art, she meets and falls in love with Alessandro. Her father's eventual loss of power allows him to acknowledge Colette and accept her artistic ambitions.
view2: Camille, an orphaned country girl and talented painter, travels to Paris for the first time with her art portfolio in hand. She hopes to make a name for herself in the city's vibrant art scene. Camille unwittingly escapes Pierre Dupont, a mysterious art dealer her guardian has secretly hired to keep an eye on her, and falls in with some bohemians from Montmartre. After Camille and her friends get arrested for exhibiting their artwork without permission, she meets and falls in love with Pierre. Her guardian's sudden inheritance allows him to acknowledge Camille as his own niece.

view1: General Dumont's daughter, Colette, is a talented painter but her scandalous artwork is leaked to the press. He tries to send her to an art school in Rome but she escapes to Barcelona to live with her sister. On the plane, she meets Lucas, a photographer. Colette thinks her sister is a wealthy socialite but she's actually a struggling artist who works as a waitress. Colette needs money and enters a local painting competition. Lucas is covering the competition for his blog.
view2: General Dumont discovers his daughter Agnes is 'A.D.', author of a scandalous novel. He tries to send her to a boarding school but she escapes to Rome to live with her sister, who turns out to be a struggling artist. On the plane, she meets Luca, an art critic. Agnes thinks her sister's studio is a luxurious gallery but it's actually a cramped atelier. Desperate for money, Agnes enters a street performance contest in the Piazza Navona. Luca is covering the event for his blog.

view1: After his boss, billionaire tech mogul Hiren Patel, is assassinated, former head of security Rohan Mehta is framed and on the run. He joins forces with a ragtag group of street kids in Mumbai's underworld to clear his name and take down the real killers. Meanwhile, Patel's daughter, Nalini, teams up with a brilliant but rebellious hacker to uncover the truth behind her father's death.
view2: After the brutal murder of his employer, Kiet Vong, head of security for the powerful Khun family, Kiet's former protégé, Suriya, is framed and on the run. Meanwhile, Nong, the son of the Khun family, takes it upon himself to find the real killer, only to be ambushed by a rival gang. With his life in danger, Nong finds refuge with a group of street kids who live in the city's seedy underbelly and falls for one of them, a tough but kind-hearted girl named Mai. As Suriya works to clear his name and evade capture, he must stay one step ahead of the ruthless gang leader, Vachir, who will stop at nothing to eliminate anyone who gets in his way.

view1: A former detective, Rachel Jenkins (played by Emily Hampshire), is haunted by her past mistakes in a series of surreal and deadly flashbacks. She's been struggling to cope with the loss of her partner and the guilt of a botched case that still haunts her. To escape the memories, she takes a solo sailing trip to a remote island, but her peace is short-lived when she discovers a mysterious cabin on the shore. The owner, a charismatic stranger named Alex (played by Tom Cullen), invites her in for shelter from an impending storm. As they spend more time together, Rachel begins to suspect that Alex may be connected to her troubled past and that he's manipulating her into participating in a twisted game of cat and mouse.
view2: A former detective, James Winter (played by Michael Shanks), is forced to take a vacation at his estranged brother's isolated lake house after a near-fatal accident. However, his peace is short-lived as he soon discovers that his brother has been conducting twisted experiments on the local wildlife, and a group of escaped convicts, led by a ruthless woman named Victoria (played by Mira Sorvino), have tracked James down to exact revenge for a past mistake. As James tries to survive and uncover the truth behind his brother's actions, he must also confront his own dark past and the consequences of his own mistakes.

view1: A man (Leonardo DiCaprio) keeps waking up in a different body, each time with no memory of who he is or how to control his new form. A group of friends' lives are turned upside down when they discover that their favorite video game has become reality. A struggling artist (Emma Stone) finds herself trapped in a never-ending loop of creating the same painting over and over. A detective (Denzel Washington) is tasked with solving a murder that keeps repeating itself, with each iteration revealing new clues. The stories intersect through the actions of a mysterious woman (Cate Blanchett) who seems to be manipulating events from behind the scenes.
view2: A man (Ken Watanabe) keeps switching bodies with his identical twin brother (also Ken Watanabe), leading to chaos in their personal and professional lives, until they discover a way to reverse the phenomenon. Meanwhile, a group of office workers are trapped in a never-ending elevator ride, forced to relive the same 30 minutes over and over again. A struggling artist (Rinko Kikuchi) becomes obsessed with creating the perfect painting, but her muse is actually a mysterious woman (Nana Eto) who is using her as inspiration for her own dark purposes.

view1: Hanna Müller, a young seamstress in Munich, marries Klaus, an engineer. In 1933, Klaus is promoted by his new boss, a high-ranking Nazi official. Despite having ties to the Social Democratic party through Hanna's father, a former union leader, the previously apolitical Klaus joins the Nazi party. After Hitler gains power, Klaus becomes increasingly involved in the regime, causing Hanna to question her husband's loyalty and where her own loyalties truly lie.
view2: Hanna Müller, a young seamstress in Munich, marries Jakob, an accountant. In 1933, Jakob is laid off by his Catholic employer due to economic downturn. Despite Hanna's family ties to the Bavarian separatist movement, Jakob joins the Nazi party for job security. After Kristallnacht, Hanna's cousin, a Jewish artist, is arrested and deported, causing Hanna to reevaluate her husband's loyalty and the country's values.

view1: The families of Leo, Ava and Jax were relocated during the war to a secluded town in no man's land near a vast desert. In present-day Bosnia, Leo works at his uncle Jax's restaurant Sahara. He lives with his grandmother Zara and takes care of her. Ava, Leo's friend, becomes Jax's business partner. Jax wants to expand the restaurant and tries to attract new investors. With the construction of a new pipeline near the town, the quiet life of the protagonists ends.
view2: The families of Luca, Ava and Leo were relocated during the socialist era to a small town on the edge of a vast forest. In modern-day Bulgaria, Luca works at his cousin Leo's restaurant Zelen. He lives with his grandmother Elena and takes care of her. Ava, Luca's friend, becomes Leo's business partner. Leo wants to renovate the restaurant and tries to attract new patrons. With the construction of a new shopping mall near the town, the quiet life of the protagonists ends.

view1: The Professor features Depardieu as tough-guy private detective Campana, hired to find Emma, the daughter of a famous scientist, who has mysteriously disappeared while working on a top-secret project in Antarctica. The case turns out to be complicated – several attempts to find her have already failed. A mathematician, Meyer, who works for the scientist, suggests a plan: Emma is known to be extremely forgetful and disorganized; therefore, the mathematician advises sending someone equally forgetful and disorganized to find her on the theory that what happened to her may also happen to him, and thus, following her steps while the detective tags along, the daughter can be found and returned home. Richard's character Perrin is an awkward, accident-prone accountant who works for the scientist, and is chosen to implement the scheme while being made to believe that HE is actually in charge of the investigation. While Campana does not believe in luck and is extremely skeptical about the plan's success, he goes along with it. The adventures of the serious detective and unlucky guy begin, with, amazingly, each misfortune Perrin suffers along the way bringing the duo one step closer each time to finding their quarry...
view2: La Vie En Rose features Depardieu as tough-guy private detective Campana, hired to find Pierre, the son of a famous musician, who has mysteriously disappeared while performing in Paris. The case turns out to be complicated – several attempts to find him have already failed. A music producer, Meyer, who works for the musician, suggests a plan: Pierre is known to be extremely forgetful and accident-prone; therefore, the producer advises sending someone equally forgetful and accident-prone to find him on the theory that what happened to him may also happen to him, and thus, following his steps while the detective tags along, the son can be found and returned home. Richard's character Perrin is an awkward, accident-prone roadie who works for the musician, and is chosen to implement the scheme while being made to believe that HE is actually in charge of the investigation. While Campana does not believe in luck and is extremely skeptical about the plan's success, he goes along with it. The adventures of the serious detective and unlucky guy begin, with, amazingly, each misfortune Perrin suffers along the way bringing the duo one step closer each time to finding their quarry...

view1: Wealthy British actress Emma Taylor (Emily Blunt) is on a trip to India attempting to put together a Bollywood film deal as part of a joint venture with an Indian production company. Before the deal can be finalized, Taylor is framed for the murder of a powerful Indian producer's son, and the film contract is instead awarded to Taylor's competitor, Vikram Singh (Naseeruddin Shah). Taylor's court-appointed lawyer, Rohan Mehta (Riz Ahmed), initially does not believe her claims of innocence, but the pair gradually unearth evidence that not only vindicates Taylor, but implicates powerful figures within the Indian film industry, exposing undeniable nepotism and corruption. Mehta manages to convince several high-ranking Indian officials to release evidence that proves Taylor's innocence. Taylor is quickly released from prison while the conspirators responsible for framing her are arrested. At the airport, Taylor asks Mehta to leave India with her, but he decides to stay, as the case has opened his eyes to the injustices rife throughout the Indian film industry. He does admit, however, that meeting Taylor has changed his life, and he now considers her a part of his family. They both share a heartfelt hug on the airport runway, before Taylor departs for London.
view2: Wealthy British actress Emma Taylor (Emily Blunt) is on a trip to India attempting to put together a Bollywood film deal as part of a joint venture with an Indian production company. Before the deal can be finalized, Taylor is framed for the murder of a powerful Indian businessman's son, and the film contract is instead awarded to Taylor's competitor, Vikram Singh (Riz Ahmed). Taylor's court-appointed lawyer, Rohan Kumar (Naseeruddin Shah), initially does not believe her claims of innocence, but the pair gradually unearth evidence that not only vindicates Taylor, but implicates powerful figures within the Indian film industry and government administration. Kumar manages to convince several high-ranking Indian officials to release evidence that proves Taylor's innocence. Taylor is quickly released from prison while the conspirators responsible for framing her are arrested. At the airport, Taylor asks Kumar to leave India with her, but he decides to stay, as the case has opened his eyes to the injustices rife throughout India. He does admit, however, that meeting Taylor has changed his life, and he now considers her a part of his family. They both share a heartfelt hug on the airport runway, before Taylor departs for London.

view1: A private investigator is hired by a wealthy businessman to gather evidence against his former business partner, who is seeking revenge by accusing him of tax evasion. The investigator employs a team of experts, including a computer hacker and a surveillance specialist, to infiltrate the accuser's office and gather incriminating documents. However, things get complicated when the hacker falls for the accuser's daughter, while the surveillance specialist becomes embroiled in a cat-and-mouse game with the accuser's henchmen. Meanwhile, the investigator discovers that the businessman is actually being blackmailed by a powerful crime lord, who will stop at nothing to protect his empire. The investigation takes a dramatic turn when the team infiltrates the crime lord's mansion for a showdown with his loyal guards and enforcers.
view2: A wealthy businessman is suing a local restaurant for serving a dish that allegedly caused him food poisoning. The restaurant hires private investigator, Mei, to dig up dirt on the businessman's past. Meanwhile, Mei's rival, detective Li, is hired by the businessman to investigate the restaurant's kitchen. As both investigators dig deeper, they uncover a web of corruption involving the city's health department and a powerful restaurateur. They soon find themselves in a cat-and-mouse game with the restaurateur's henchmen, leading to a showdown at an abandoned warehouse.

view1: Event coordinator Emma is staging a high-end conference at a luxurious ski resort, but her day quickly unravels as she deals with a belligerent keynote speaker, a missing audio-visual technician, and a group of rowdy attendees. Meanwhile, she's on the verge of a breakup with her boyfriend and her business partner is embezzling funds. As the conference descends into chaos, Emma discovers that her staff has secretly planned an unforgettable surprise for the guests, transforming the event into a night to remember.
view2: Event coordinator Emma is staging a high-profile charity gala at a luxurious mansion, but her personal life is in shambles as she's on the verge of a divorce and her affair with one of her employees is about to be exposed. The event is plagued by last-minute cancellations, equipment failures, and a temperamental celebrity guest, but Emma's staff manages to keep everything together until a surprise power outage threatens to ruin the evening. Just when all hope seems lost, Emma's team pulls off an incredible recovery, transforming the gala into a memorable success that raises millions for charity.

view1: Eva Norová goes to visit her uncle Leo for his 50th anniversary of being a master craftsman. Uncle Leo's wish is to learn how to make the kind of intricate wooden clocks that his neighbour, wealthy businesswoman Záhorská has collected. However, uncle Leo is not on friendly terms with his neighbour. Eva applies for a job as an intern in order to steal the blueprints for making the clocks. Meanwhile, Eva's sister Tereza, who has fallen in love with Záhorská's son Jan, also makes her way to the Záhorská residence. Eva in turn falls in love with the Záhorskás' personal assistant, Adam Kučera, who has been sent by his family to spy on Záhorská and retrieve a stolen family heirloom. When Eva brings the blueprints for making the clocks to her uncle, she finds out that he already got them from Jan's sister Alena, and Eva returns the blueprints. In the end everything turns out well, the Záhorskás become friends with uncle Leo and offer him the clock-making blueprints themselves, Adam's family heirloom is returned, Tereza gets engaged to Jan and Eva gets together with Adam.
view2: Eva Norová goes to visit her uncle Leo for his 70th birthday, but he's not the reason she's there. Her friend Zdenka has been searching for a rare type of orchid and thinks it might be growing in Uncle Leo's greenhouse. Eva applies for a job as a gardener at the estate to get close to the greenhouse. Meanwhile, her cousin Martin falls in love with Uncle Leo's granddaughter, Anna, who is also working at the estate. Eva meets the estate's head gardener, Tomáš, and they start a romance. But when Eva finally gets into the greenhouse, she finds out that Zdenka already found the orchid a week earlier from a different source. In the end, everything works out: Uncle Leo becomes friends with Zdenka, Anna and Martin get engaged, and Eva and Tomáš are happy together.

view1: A struggling artist, Tiko, visits his local art gallery in search of someone to showcase his latest paintings. However, the employees are too engrossed in their personal conversations and games on their phones to even acknowledge him. As Tiko waits, he discovers that the building's electrical system is on the verge of a catastrophic failure, but no one takes notice. Eventually, the power grid collapses, and the gallery is forced to relocate to a trendy new space. But when Tiko returns for an exhibition, he finds that the employees have simply traded in their phones for tablets, still neglecting their duties as they chase after social media fame.
view2: A young artist, Keti, visits her local art gallery in search of someone to display her latest paintings. However, the gallery owner and staff are too distracted by their own personal interests - the owner is obsessed with his new smartphone, while the staff are engrossed in a heated game of chess. Meanwhile, the building's electrical system begins to malfunction, causing lights to flicker and equipment to short circuit. Despite the chaos, no one notices Keti or her artwork until it's too late - the gallery collapses in an explosion of sparks and dust. The owner and staff emerge unscathed, but still glued to their phones and chessboard, as they relocate to a new, high-tech facility that promises even greater distractions.

view1: Twenty-year-old Sofia Rodriguez is forced to drop out of art school after her activist mother, Elena, is arrested and imprisoned for protesting against government corruption. Sofia takes a job as a photographer's assistant but soon falls in love with her boss, Alexander Petrov, who turns out to be the son of the judge who sentenced her mother. Their relationship ends when Alexander's father is exposed as corrupt, and Sofia witnesses him accepting bribes from wealthy clients. After Elena's release, she learns about her daughter's affair with the judge's son and publicly confronts him, leading Sofia to distance herself from both families and pursue a career in photography.
view2: Twenty-one-year-old Sofia Rodriguez's aspirations to study Environmental Science are put on hold when her mother, Ana, is arrested and charged with eco-terrorism after participating in a peaceful protest against a corrupt corporation. Unable to attend college, Sofia takes up work as a park ranger. She meets and falls for Alex Chen, an older, married man who turns out to be the CEO of the very corporation her mother protested. Their affair ends when Chen is exposed for using his company's influence to silence critics like Ana. After Ana's release, she discovers her daughter's relationship with the CEO and attacks Sofia. Eventually, Sofia distances herself from both of them and decides to pursue her forgotten dream.

view1: Director Evald Schorm reflects on the changing political tides of his generation in this poignant exploration of idealism and disillusionment. Markéta (Magda Vášárová) is a charismatic student leader fervently dedicated to the principles of her university's progressive movement. But as those around her grow increasingly disenchanted with the cause, she must confront a shattering realization: that everything she has fought for has been built on shaky ground.
view2: Director Evald Schorm reflects on the changing political tides of his generation in this clear-eyed study of idealism and disillusionment. Jarda (Jan Kačer) is a passionate young artist fervently dedicated to the principles of free expression. But as those around him grow increasingly disenchanted with the art world, he must confront a sobering realization: that everything he has created has been for nothing.

view1: A young man receives a mysterious package containing his late father's belongings, with no return address or indication of who sent it. Determined to uncover the truth behind this enigmatic gesture, he sets out on a perilous journey across the desert to find the sender. As he navigates treacherous landscapes and hostile strangers, he begins to unravel a web of family secrets and deceit that threaten to consume him.
view2: A young man receives a mysterious letter from his estranged father, who has been missing for years. The letter is addressed to him, but there's no return address and no indication of where it came from. Determined to uncover the truth about his family's past, the young man sets out on a journey to find his father, facing numerous obstacles and dangers along the way.

view1:
{
  "": "1915, Italian advance through Albania: the young war volunteer Marco 'Mark' Rossi (Bianchi) is given food by an equally young Albanian woman (Gjergji). 
1918, Fourth Battle of Isonzo: Mark, now a lieutenant, is frustrated about the propaganda at the Home Front, so he spends his leave in the mountains behind the Italian Front. 
While staying in a village inn, he meets the young woman again. They fall in love. 
Early 1919, Austro-Hungarian retreat after the Armistice: Liri and Mark meet again only to be chased by an Albanian mob. Shortly prior to being lynched by the mob, a group of passing Italian soldiers, tired about fighting, saves them.
view2: 1914, German advance through France: young French soldier Pierre Dupont is given food by an elderly woman Claire in a small village. 1916, Battle of Verdun: Pierre, now a lieutenant, is disillusioned with the war effort and spends his leave in a nearby town. He meets Claire's granddaughter Colette at a local café. They fall in love. Late 1918, German retreat after the Armistice: Pierre and Colette meet again but are caught by French authorities for fraternizing with the enemy. A group of sympathetic soldiers intervenes on their behalf, saving them from execution.

view1: The novel is from the point of view of the French actress Colette Devereaux over the course of three revolutions. During the Paris Commune, at age 20, Devereaux loses her brother, a young revolutionary, and decides that she is against violence. Her second husband, Captain Alexandre Dumont, shares her pacifistic convictions even though he is an officer in the French army. He fought in the Franco-Prussian War alongside Prussia in 1870, and in the Paris Commune suppression in 1871. Devereaux' mother dies of a broken heart after losing her son, and her father dies of illness due to the harsh conditions during the siege. Alexandre then retires from the army to support Devereaux' peace activism. During the Russian Revolution, Alexandre is arrested while staying in Moscow because he is suspected of being a French spy. Devereaux' daughter from her first marriage, Sophie, begins to follow in her mother's footsteps.
view2: The novel is from the point of view of the English governess, Emily Fanshawe, over the course of three wars. During the Crimean War, at age 20, Fanshawe loses her fiancé, Captain James Parker, and decides that she is against war. Her second husband, Dr. Henry Lee, shares her pacifistic convictions even though he is a surgeon in the British army. He worked in the Indian Rebellion of 1857, and in the Second Opium War in 1860. Fanshawe's brother dies of cholera because of the war, and her mother dies of grief after losing her son. Henry then retires from the army to support Fanshawe's peace activism. During the Taiping Rebellion, Henry is captured while staying in Shanghai because he is suspected of being a British spy. Fanshawe's daughter from her first engagement begins to follow in her mother's footsteps.

view1: After graduating from the prestigious London School of Economics, Olivia Lee lands a job as policy analyst in the Prime Minister's office. Existing senior staff do not welcome a talented newcomer who may become a competitor but her abilities are recognised by the Prime Minister and, most important, by Jenkins, the career official heading the department. That said, coming up with the right words for the constantly changing world situation and the constantly changing reactions of the Prime Minister proves no easy task. She gets hastily written drafts past Jenkins, and past other senior staff who rubbish them, only to find that the Prime Minister's needs have changed. The film ends in March 2003 with a re-enactment of the actual speech by Tony Blair to the House of Commons, at which he contradicted claims by George Bush and Donald Rumsfeld and argued passionately for regime change in Iraq but not military intervention.
view2: After graduating from the prestigious business school, INSEAD, Emma Taylor lands a job as speechwriter in the CEO's office of a major tech firm. Existing senior executives do not welcome a talented newcomer who may become a competitor but her abilities are recognised by the CEO and, most important, by Thompson, the career executive heading the department. That said, coming up with the right words for the constantly changing market situation and the constantly changing reactions of the CEO proves no easy task. She gets hastily written drafts past Thompson, and past other senior executives who rubbish them, only to find that the CEO's needs have changed. The film ends in March 2020 with a re-enactment of the actual speech by Satya Nadella to the World Economic Forum, at which he contradicted claims by Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos and argued passionately for sustainable business practices but not corporate greed.

view1: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson come out of retirement to investigate a mysterious theft. They find that an Italian art thief, known as 'The Fox', has asked Professor Moriarty to steal a priceless painting from the British Museum. Holmes outsmarts Moriarty, solves the theft and brings The Fox to justice.
view2: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson come out of retirement to investigate a mysterious murder. They find that an Italian Mafia organisation called The Camorra has asked evil mastermind Professor Moriarty to wreak vengeance on Inspector Maras, the detective who sent them to prison. Holmes outsmarts Moriarty, solves the murder and brings Moriarty to justice.

view1: At home in his Los Angeles apartment, Ethan Hunt is sedated, then kidnapped and persuaded by threats of physical force, the promise of money, and the lure of a beautiful artist to travel to South America, assuming the identity of a local language-speaking street musician. His job is to help break a cocaine cartel that is smuggling drugs into the United States, then selling them on the black market. But the cartel members are tipped off that he is on his way.
view2: At home in his Tokyo office, Kenji Kuroba is drugged, then kidnapped and persuaded by threats of financial ruin, the promise of a high-paying job, and the allure of a beautiful assistant to travel to Southeast Asia, assuming the identity of a local language-speaking consultant. His mission is to help dismantle a counterfeit goods ring that is smuggling fake luxury items into China, then selling them online. But the scammers are tipped off that he's on his way.

view1: In the late 1600s, a powerful sorceress is executed in England and places a curse on the kingdom before she dies. One century later, the site of her execution remains untouched by the locals due to fear of the curse. The curse forces men to turn against each other, leading to endless wars and bloodshed. A young warrior named Leonidas discovers his connection to the sorceress's family and is tasked with finding a way to lift the curse. He journeys to the underworld, where he battles fierce demons and forges an alliance with the ruler of Hell to track down the original sorceress and put an end to her malevolent legacy.
view2: In the late 1600s, a sorceress is executed in England and places a curse on the town before she dies. One century later, the well where she was drowned still stands with no one daring to destroy it. The curse remains by causing men to fall into madness. A young apprentice, Emilia, is accused of witchcraft and imprisoned. Hercules comes forth to fight evil and discovers that the sorceress's descendant, a powerful warlock, has taken over the town. He uproots the cursed well and finds an entrance to Purgatory where he attempts to track down the original sorceress to break her curse and free the tormented souls.

view1: After the war, cousins Ethan and Lucas return to their family's plantation in Louisiana. Ethan is content with managing the estate, but Lucas has grand ambitions, emulating the ruthless tactics of wealthy landowner Auguste Dumont. When Auguste's daughter Colette sets her sights on Lucas, a series of heated clashes between the two men ultimately leads to Auguste's demise. Lucas becomes a powerful force in the region, amassing wealth and influence by exploiting loopholes in the law and bribing officials. However, his success comes at a cost: he corrupts many in authority and earns the enmity of those who seek justice. When the sheriff of New Orleans is forced out due to his connections with Lucas, Ethan takes up the mantle of law and order, setting the stage for a violent confrontation between the cousins.
view2: After the Civil War, Brothers Ethan and Lucas Ross return to Georgia and to their family's plantation. Ethan is happy to simply help manage the farm, but Lucas's ambition is to build a railroad empire, the way ruthless industrialist Harrison Grant has. From the moment they meet, Grant's daughter Abigail has romantic designs on Lucas. After a series of confrontations between the two men result in Grant's death, the two become involved. Lucas becomes a powerful figure, overseeing a vast network that involves smuggling goods and buying up land by taking advantage of lax regulations. He corrupts many officials and makes many enemies. When the sheriff of Atlanta is relieved of duty due to his association with Lucas, Ethan becomes the law and a violent showdown between the brothers is inevitable.

view1: Landowner Harrison seeks to expand his property after discovering gold deposits under the Apache territory. A peace treaty with the Apaches provides security, and settlers arrive in the area. Disguised as soldiers, Harrison's men attack the Apaches. Grey Wolf, the chief of the Apaches, then digs up the peace pipe. After a bloody raid, the village's surviving settlers seek shelter in the nearby fort of Captain Thompson and his men. Due to the peace treaty, however, the fort is undermanned and Thompson is unable to act. He hires trapper Marcus Rodriguez to investigate the cause of the Indian uprising, uncovering Harrison's deceitful plan, which he tells Grey Wolf. They and the Apaches arrive at the fort just in time to assist the soldiers and settlers against the attack by Harrison's men.
view2: Landowner Harrison wants to expand his property because he knows about gold deposits under the Apache territory. Settlers also come to the area, as a peace treaty with the Apaches provides security. Disguised as soldiers, Harrison has his men attack the Apaches. Grey Wolf, the chief of the Apache, then digs up the war drum. After a bloody raid, the village's surviving settlers seek shelter in the nearby fort of Captain Thompson and his men. Due to the peace treaty, however, the fort is undermanned and Thompson is unable to act. He hires trapper James Reed to investigate the cause of the Indian uprising, uncovering Harrison's deceitful plan, which he tells Grey Wolf. They and the Apaches arrive at the fort just in time to assist the soldiers and settlers against the attack by Harrison's men.

view1: Upon being promoted to head the elite Counter-Terrorism Unit, Rachel Jenkins begins to suspect that the evidence used to convict her former partner, Alex Chen, of treason is fabricated. As she digs deeper, she discovers a web of deceit involving corrupt government officials and rogue military operatives. Despite warnings from her superiors to drop the case, Rachel persists in uncovering the truth, putting herself at risk of being framed for the very crime she's investigating. Her determination ultimately leads to the exposure of a mole within the unit who has been feeding classified information to a terrorist organization, and Alex Chen is exonerated.
view2: Upon being promoted to lead the Special Task Force, the top-secret unit of the British police, Emily Taylor begins to discover that the evidence used to convict James Mitchell of murder, which resulted in his imprisonment for life, is questionable at best. As she investigates further, she discovers that the witnesses were coerced and the forensic evidence was tampered with. Moreover, the real culprit who committed the crime is actually still on the loose. Warned off the investigation by her superiors, Taylor persists, risking her career and her life, to free an innocent man from unjust imprisonment and to bring a serial killer to justice.

view1: In 1955, the US Air Force plane Aurora disappears during a secret experiment to make it invisible. In 2020, researchers try to recreate the experiment, but it has an unexpected effect: making the Aurora reappear in ancient Egypt. The sole survivor of the original experiment is on board and meets his now-adult great-granddaughter, who is an archaeologist. As they try to figure out what's happening, more people are pulled into the time loop. A rival research team tries to exploit the phenomenon for their own gain, leading to a thrilling adventure as the survivors fight to return to their proper timelines.
view2: In 1945, the British Royal Air Force's HMS Defiance disappears during an experiment to make warships invisible. In 2015, researchers try to recreate the experiment, but it has the unintended consequence of making the Defiance reappear in modern-day London. The sole survivor of the original experiment is a young girl who was on board with her family. She meets up with her now-adult daughter, who helps her unravel the mystery behind their reappearance. As they try to find a way back to their own time, more people from different eras start getting trapped on the Defiance, including a group of modern-day hackers and a 19th-century pirate. The research company tries to cover up the incident by silencing everyone involved, but a secret organization steps in to help the survivors escape through time and space.

view1: Deep Space 15, orbiting the planet of Xeridia in the Delta Quadrant, follows the daily life of its crew as they encounter an ancient alien entity known as 'The Devourer'. A rogue group of Trill, seeking to exploit The Devourer's power, become the primary antagonists. As the series progresses, a mysterious energy signature emanating from the planet's core becomes a key focus, drawing in various species including the Kazon, Voth, and even a lone Bajoran warrior.
view2: On the space station Aurora's Hope, in orbit of the planet Xeridia, a group of officers navigate their daily lives amidst the complexities of intergalactic politics and ancient alien artifacts. The crew encounters the enigmatic Zorvath, an advanced species with abilities that blur the lines between technology and magic. As tensions rise, a rogue trader named Vexar emerges as a key antagonist, followed by the mysterious Xeridian Order and their sinister plans to harness the power of the planet's ancient relics. Meanwhile, the crew must also contend with the arrival of the enigmatic Kraelion, a being from beyond the galaxy who holds secrets about the origins of the universe.

view1: A group of French privateers, who had been raiding English shipping lanes, put into a small Irish port to repair their damaged vessel. The locals, weary of the constant attacks on their trade, were initially hostile but the French convinced them that they would be rewarded for their cooperation with a share of the spoils from future raids. However, as news of the privateers' activities spread, the villagers began to see them as little better than pirates and soon turned against their supposed allies.
view2: A group of French privateers, involved in numerous battles on the side of the English navy during the American Revolution, put into a small village on the Canadian coast for repairs after suffering significant damage. They convince the villagers that the British have been defeated and they are now in control, but the villagers' cooperation turns to rebellion as rumors spread about the privateers' true intentions.

view1: A small village of Krasnyi Oskol, once a peaceful place, now hosts families who came to honor their loved ones who didn't return from World War II. In the movie 'Echoes of Memories', two parallel storylines unfold: one in the summer of 1975 and another in April 1944. By the end of the film, the battle scene on April 14, 1944, comes to a close, and the audience is left with a sense of remembrance on April 14, 1975.
view2: A small village of Krasnaya Polyana was once a peaceful place, but during the great Patriotic war, it became a battleground. Now, in the summer of 1975, relatives of those who fought and died come to visit their loved ones' graves. The movie 'Echoes of War' shows two parallel storylines: one develops in the mid-1970s, the other - in the spring of 1944. By the end of the movie lines are closed on the battlefield, which takes place on April 12, 1944 and the memory of which honor the audience on April 12, 1975.

view1: The film opens in a Japanese submarine as it returns from a mission to attack an American aircraft carrier. It then follows the crew onshore the day before they ship off for their next mission—reuniting with their families and engaging in a traditional tea ceremony. Then they ship off, soon sighting and boarding a South Korean fishing vessel, which they inspect for contraband. The boarding of the ship is shown being done professionally and in a non-confrontational manner. While they are aboard the fishing vessel, a North Korean submarine spots them and tries to torpedo them, but the Japanese submarine ends up sinking it.
view2: The film opens aboard an aircraft carrier as it returns from a mission. It then follows the pilots onshore the day before they ship off for their next mission—meeting their family and sweethearts, spending a last night at a bar, and so forth. Then they ship off, soon engaging in dogfighting with enemy planes, which they defeat with skill and precision. While they are airborne, an airbase spots them and tries to scramble more planes against them, but the pilots end up shooting down all of them.

view1: Detective James Mitchell is a seasoned investigator in the affluent, upscale neighborhood of Beverly Hills, California--until he makes a mistake that costs him his badge. As punishment, he is assigned to work in South Central, considered one of the most violent and high-crime areas in Los Angeles. Everyone at the precinct is certain that the 'by the book' veteran cop is going to get himself (and whoever is assigned as his partner), killed. However, when James's younger brother is murdered during a gang-related shooting, he throws all rules out the window tracking down the killer and sparking a violent confrontation with the gangs.
view2: Police Officer Jack Harris is a seasoned veteran in Oakwood, a tranquil, upscale neighborhood of Los Angeles--until he arrests a prominent politician and his account of the incident is discredited. As punishment, he is reassigned to work Skid Row, considered the most hazardous, high-crime area in the city. Everyone at the precinct is convinced that the 'by the book' veteran cop is going to get himself (and whoever is assigned as his partner), killed. Sergeant James Mitchell draws the unfortunate 'babysitting' assignment. However, when Jack's younger brother is murdered investigating a stolen motorcycle, Jack disregards protocol tracking down the killer.

view1: Lena Grant (Sandra Oh), a former Black Panther, has been on the run from the law for 15 years for a crime she didn't commit: bombing a police station in Oakland, California. Jack Harris (Chris Evans), an FBI agent with a troubled past, is tasked with transporting Grant back to Oakland for trial. Their journey takes them through treacherous terrain and into the path of corrupt Sheriff McCoy, leading to a desperate escape. As Harris confronts his own demons, he begins to question the system that has pursued Grant for so long.
view2: Hank Mitchell (Ryan Gosling) is a former anarchist who has been on the run from the law for 15 years for his involvement in a bank heist that went wrong. He's been living off the grid, but his life of solitude is disrupted when he's tracked down by FBI agent Rachel Jenkins (Emma Stone). As they embark on a cross-country road trip to return Hank to Los Angeles for trial, they're pursued by a ruthless Sheriff who has a personal vendetta against Hank. Along the way, Hank and Rachel form an unlikely bond as they confront their troubled pasts and learn to trust each other.

view1: In Tokyo, Japan, former CIA operative Rachel Kim (Gal Gadot) is shot and left for dead by two rogue agents, Victor (Michael Fassbender) and Lena (Charlize Theron). When Rachel wakes up in a hospital, she's placed under the protection of Detective Kenji Nakamura (Ken Watanabe), who's tasked with keeping her safe from Victor and Lena. As they close in on Rachel, she must use her skills to evade them and uncover their sinister plot to steal classified information.
view2: In Los Angeles, California, Alexandra 'Lexi' Thompson (Emily Ratajkowski) is caught in the crossfire of two corrupt detectives, Victor (Michael Peña) and Rachel (Gina Carano). Lexi wakes up in a hospital and as a witness to one of their crimes, she's placed under the protection of seasoned FBI agent Ethan Brooks (Dwayne Johnson). However, when Victor and Rachel discover Lexi is the key to tracing them back to the crime, they turn up at the hospital to finish the job. Trapped inside, Lexi must use her wits and resourcefulness to evade her pursuers and call for help from Brooks, who's racing against time to reach her before it's too late.

view1: Undercover MI6 agent Rachel Jenkins (Emily Blunt) travels to Turkey to stop a rogue agent from selling classified information to the highest bidder. When the rogue agent is caught, he reveals that the real target was Rachel's own sister, Sophia (Brie Larson), who has been working undercover in the Middle East. Rachel must now escort Sophia back to London while being hunted by a ruthless mercenary (Tom Hardy) who will stop at nothing to get his hands on the classified information.
view2: Undercover MI6 agent, Rachel Jenkins (Emma Stone), is sent to Morocco to intercept a rogue scientist who possesses knowledge of a deadly virus. However, upon arrival, she discovers that her cover has been blown and the scientist has escaped. Jenkins is then tasked with escorting a brilliant but rebellious Moroccan hacker, Amir (Rami Malek), back to London. As they navigate through the treacherous streets of Marrakech, they realize that the rogue scientist will stop at nothing to sell the virus to the highest bidder, putting millions of lives at risk. With the CIA and MI6 hot on their heels, Jenkins and Amir must fight against time to prevent a global catastrophe.
